loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Mosafar

texts.ru: Мосафар проживает в районе Яван. Ей 52 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Мосафар занимается животноводством. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mosafar lives in the Yavan district.  She is 52 years old, married and has three children.  Mosafar is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Raissa

texts.fr:
Cliente de 22 ans, mariée sans enfant a sa charge, 2007  elle perd son père était obligée d’arrêter ses études en classe de quatrième et avec la somme d'argent reçue a la mort de ses parents, elle se lance dans la vente des pacotilles,ses ventes sont de 18.000 a 40.000 frs par jour.
Elle s'approvisionne a Kinshasa et elle a pour stratégie de faire des prix accessibles pour favoriser l’écoulement de sa marchandise.
A l'octroi de son prêt, elle va acheter des bijoux en pacotilles,des barrettes et de parures de tous genre et  tous ce dont les femmes ont besoin pour leur fête,acheter des tôles et des planches pour construire un étalage pour donner une visibilité de son affaire.
Elle est très gentille et entreprenante , elle pense aller loin dans son business.
texts.en:
Raissa is 22 and married with no children. When her father died in 2007, she was forced to stop her studies during her third year of high school. With the money she inherited on the death of her parents, she started a retail business selling low-cost goods. Her daily sales amount to between 18 000 and 40 000 francs. She gets her merchandise in Kinshasa and resells it at affordable prices in order to encourage sales.
She will use this loan to buy cheap jewelery, hair clips and party finery for women. She will also buy sheet metal and shelves with which to build a display on which to showcase her wares. Raissa is a kind and enterprising woman who has the confidence to go far in her business.

loans.use: to buy cheap jewelery, hair clips, etc.

loans.name: Zokirchon

texts.ru:
Зокирчон женат и любящий отец 5 детей. Он добрый, умный и целеустремленный человек. Более 8 лет Зокирчон занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает пшеницу, лук и кукуруза. Ему помогает в данном бизнесе его супруга и старшие дети. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Зокирчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыль. Он мечтает, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу, и улучшить свою жилищное условие. Зокирчон запрашивает займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений, семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Zokirchon is married and is a loving father of five children.  He is kind, smart and goal-oriented person.  Zokirchon has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 8 years.  He grows wheat, onions and corn.  His wife and older children help him with this business.  Besides this, he is also involved in animal husbandry.  Zokirchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He dreams of placing his children into good schools and improving his living conditions.  Zokirchon is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, seeds, lubricant materials and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, lubricant materials and livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase dowry goods to increase profit

loans.name: Antenitta

texts.en:
Antenitta is 27 years old with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling bread and some fruit in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Antenitta requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and fruit like mangoes.

loans.name: Oysamo

texts.ru: Ойсамо проживает в районе Дангары. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже два года как Ойсамо занимается торговлей. Она продает парфюмерию и женскую одежду. В основном она ходит по кишлакам и продает свой товар. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Oysamo lives in the Dangara district.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for two years.  She sells perfumery and women's clothing.  She primarily travels to villages and sells her merchandise.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nazirira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Baraka Alanine », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 38  ans, mère de 4 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école primaire. Elle est  vendeuse d’habits  (pantalons et chemises, habits enfants, pagnes, jupes).  Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal Himbi-katindo. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 dizaines de pantalons et de chemises  à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The featured client, Nazirira, is the leader of the “Baraka Alanine” business group.  She is a young entrepreneur and a 38-year-old mother of four young children who are still in elementary school.  She sells clothing (pants and shirts, children’s clothing, pagnes and skirts).  Her husband is a small-scale retailer.  She sets up her items for sale in the Himbi-Katindo neighborhood market.  She has been doing these sorts of small-scale income-generating activities for nine years, but has recently completed 10 loan cycles with Hekima.  This newest loan will help her increase her stock with two dozen pairs of pants and shirts to sell.  In addition, she wants to see her children grow up comfortably and grow her business.  The featured client would like to thank Hekima for its work on behalf of disadvantaged women who don’t have access to conventional banks.

loans.use: to purchase two dozen pairs of pants and shirts

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatmata H.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of 12,700,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, these teachers will repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Fatmata is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kambia town, the 55 year old woman is married and has 3 children – 2 in college and the other is no longer attending school. Fatmata, who has served in the teaching profession for 37 years now is going to use her share of the loan to pay college fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her children

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling bed sheets in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Abdirahmon

texts.ru: Абдирахмон житель района Хуросон. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его сын находится в Российской Федерации. Он сам имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии работает 32 года. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Abdirahmon lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 54 years old, married and has three children.  His son is in the Russian Federation.  Abdirahmon has a higher education and is a teacher.  He has been working in his field for 32 years.  Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds calves for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sizimisele Group

texts.en:
Elinah comes from Gweru and is 43 years old. She is widowed with two children aged 10 and 18. The younger child is attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Elinah runs a poultry business and sells farm produce. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenges she faces are a lack of funds to purchase feedstock and unavailability of feedstock. Elinah has requested a loan of $400 to buy piglets for a piggery project. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s daily diet. In the future Elinah plans to have 200 pigs and 2000 chicks for her two projects.

loans.use: to buy piglets for the piggery project.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 42 years old and married with seven children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Meriam requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. Her hope is to build a house with the extra income from this loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, hair extensions,braids,shampoos,conditioners etc

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is 28 years old and single with six children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread, oil, and flour in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Poni requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Women's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old and believes he is on track to be highly successful with his restaurant in Lugazi. He has strong knowledge of the fundamentals of running a business. He has operated this business for the past ten years. 

Joseph, a father of three, says that the key to his success is his ability to sell foods that his customers enjoy. Many of his customers are partial to foods such as bananas, cassava, beans, rice and green vegetables. With his business firmly established and getting stronger all the time, Joseph says he is intent on owing this business for the long-term. He says being ahead of the pack is what he wants.

He also has a second business: rentals. Weekly, he says the gross sales income from his business is 50,000 UGX. This loan, Joseph says, is to purchase better furniture like chairs and tables.

loans.use: to purchase better chairs and tables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase herbicide and also to employ labor to assist in weeding irish potatoes.

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia is 49 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Ludia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is  53 years old and married to Emily. They have five children. He has been farming for a period of four years. He earns a monthly income of KES.20,000. This is his second loan. Jackson will use the loan to purchase more cows and sheep to rear and sell.

Jackson will use the anticipated profits to maintain his business. His hopes and dreams for his farming and family is to uplift and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cows and sheep to rear and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en: Samiya opened a clothing store in a central location of her town. After gaining experience and proving she could manage her business well and earn extra monthly income, Samiya was ready to expand her enterprise. She now sells gifts, trinkets and cosmetics in addition to children's and adults' clothing. Samiya needed this loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics stock for the holiday season and the beginning of the school year. Samiya is opening a savings account for her children and wants to ensure support for their education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics stock for the holiday season and the new school year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for renovations to the shop and to purchase shelves and racks to keep cloth.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is a 21-year-old mother of two. She recently completed the Social Services Day Care Training Course and has been certified to open her day care for this school year. She prepared a place in her home for the child care but needed to develop an outside play area for the children and infants. In Rena's area, there are no other home-based day care centers and one is sorely needed.

Rena needed this loan to create a sandbox play area and to purchase toys, play sets, shelves, cots and other supplies. Rena wants to establish her day care and keep it running professionally while creating a loving environment for the children.

loans.use: to create a sandbox play area, purchase toys, play sets, shelves, and cots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags, cases and travel bags.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 13. In 2001, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Mira plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional fabric or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Balikuddembe Women's Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Grace is a happy camper. She is highly optimistic. For the past decade, Grace has been bringing tenacity, diligence, and determination to her food sales enterprise in the Lugazi food market.
Hard work is an important part of her daily routine.
Grace, a happily-married mother of 7, has struck quite a chord with many of her clients with her friendly attitude and the way she acts expeditiously in attending to them.
Unbeknownst to her, it has kept clients coming and her business afloat.
Grace sells staple foods such as bananas, maize flour, sweet potatoes, yams, Irish potatoes, green vegetables, and rice.
Grace also subsists on some modest income from a cattle sales business. Prior to engaging in the above business, she was leaning more toward farming.
Grace is on the ball and she sees more success on the horizon. Her determination, hard work ethic, and tenacity are distinguishing traits that will continually work in her favor.
She says that her weekly gross sales are to the tune of Uganda shillings 50,000.
Grace says she intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase more bananas, rice, and sweet potatoes to resell, and will use the rest to pay fees for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, rice, and sweet potatoes to resell, and to pay fees for her kids.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Trabajadoras se encuentra en el ciclo 15 del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, cuenta con 16 integrantes todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. El Comité demuestra querer cumplir con los compromisos que exige la Fundación. Todas tienen una actividad productiva en donde invierten todas las ganancias que tiene; así mismo se muestran muy alegres y con ganas de superación.
La señora Felicia se dedica a la venta venta de carbón, por medio de este trabajo ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, y de esa forma darles una vida digna y decorosa. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, pues últimamente este negocio se ha vuelto muy ventajoso, pues el gas está muy caro, entonces las personas optan por el consumo del carbón.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, ya que por medio de esto puede cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, está muy contenta con la ayuda de la Fundación, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras Communal Bank is in its fifteenth loan cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. It is made up of 16 members, all of them friends and neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa. The communal bank has shown its commitment to comply with the requirements of Fundación Paraguaya. All of the members have productive business where they invest their profits; consequently they are all happy and demonstrate a desire to succeed.

Sra. Felicia sells coal and through this work she obtains the necessary income to maintain her family and give them a decent life. She notes that she has many customers and that lately the business has become very profitable since gas is very expensive and people are opting to consume coal instead.

Felicia is requesting this loan to buy coal so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She is quite happy about this loan from the Fundación as it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy coal for later sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle repair work

loans.name: Forjando Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Forjando Futuro” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran L. artesanía, L. venta D. ropa, venta D. joyas y venta D. abarrotes en un alM.én. Todos ellos pertenecientes a L. ciudad D. Temuco.
Carolina integrante del Banco comunal quien en L. foto se encuentra sentada en primera fiL., ocupando el primer puesto D. derecha a izquierda, viste con ropa oscura y su cabello está suelto y es D. color castaño oscuro. 
ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropa nueva desD. hace un año, sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta y también desD. su casa. Generalmente su horario es D. lunes a viernes durante las tardes. Carolina brinda facilidades D. pago a sus clientes, lo que ha facilitado sus ventas y acrecentar el número D. clienteL.. Su mercadería L. compra usualmente en L. ciudad D. Santiago. 
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido D. venta D. ropa, en el cual también pueda incorporar L. venta D. juguetes. 
Con el crédito comprará chalecos, polerones, poleras, todo D. acuerdo a L. temporada. 
Carolina vive junto a su marido y su hija D. dos años D. edad. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y un mejor bienestar. 
ElL. está muy contenta y agradecida D. los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda compartiendo con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que son muy comprometidos, responsables y agradables. Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas L. han ayudado a administrar D. mejor manera su negocio.
Temuco es L. capital D. L. región D. L. Araucanía. L. ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur D. Santiago (capital D. Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie D. balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% D. los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Forjando Futuro" ("Shaping the Future").  It is maD. up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields.  Among them are handicrafts, clothing sales, jewelry sales, and grocery sales in a store.  All the entrepreneurs live in the city of Temuco.

Carolina is a member of the Communal Bank, who is seated in the front row of the photo, first person to the right.  She is wearing dark clothes, and her dark brown hair is down.

She has been working selling new clothes for the last year.  She makes her sales by going door to door, and also out of her home.  Generally, her schedule is to work Mondays to Fridays in the afternoons.  Carolina offers payment facilities to her customers, which has maD. her sales easier and gained her a number of customers.  She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago.

Her goals for her business are to have established premises selling clothing, where she can also incluD. toys for sale.  With the loan she will buy vests, sweatshirts, and shirts, according to the season.

Carolina lives with her husband and her two-year-old daughter.  Her dreams are to continue working to be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of live and improved well-being.

She is very happy and grateful for the loans and for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza.  She also feels very comfortable participating in the Communal Bank group, as they are very committed, responsible and nice people.  In regard to the trainings, these have helped her to manager her business in a better way.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There is a string of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) in the surrounding area, and striking native flora and fauna are concentrated in the national parks nearby.  It is worth nothing that 50% of the Mapuches, the indigenous people from our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy vests, sweatshirts, and shirts, according to the season.

loans.name: Abaticumugambi/ Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Venuste fait partie du groupe Abaticumugambi. Il est né au Rwanda et a 45 ans,il est marié et il a 3 enfants de 1 à 9 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. 

Venuste est agriculteur du riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des fertilisants(NPK,Urée), utiliser dans les champs du riz et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accroitre des champs en utilisant le système d’irrigation en vue d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Venuste voudrait devenir une grande agriculteur du riz , payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Venuste is a member of the Abaticumugambi group.  He was born in Rwanda and is 45 years old.  He is married and a father of three children ranging from one to nine years old, one of whom attends school.  He himself completed four years of elementary school.  
Vénusté is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He plans on using his loan to purchase fertilizers (NPK, urea) to use on his rice fields and pay workers.  
His business growth strategy is to increase his farming land by using irrigation systems, with the ultimate goal of increasing production.  In the next few years, Venuste would like to become a large-scale rice producer, pay tuition fees for his children and pay his family’s medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (NPK, urea) to use on his rice fields and to pay workers

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr: Monsieur Youssouf est âgé de 43 ans .Il habite au Sénégal.  Il exerce la profession de militaire dans l’armée de l’air depuis 22 ans.  C’est une occupation qu’il a choisi par amour pour servir son pays. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est la discipline et la rigueur qui sont respectées dans ce corps de métier. Youssouf est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour les dépenses  de voyage de ses enfants qui doivent partir en vacance dans son village natal. Ce financement lui permettra d’assurer un certain. épanouissement  pour sa famille.
texts.en: Youssouf is 43 years old.  He lives in Senegal.  He has been working as a soldier in the air force for 22 years.  He chose this work out of love for serving his country.  His favorite thing about his job is the respect for discipline and hard work in the profession.  Youssouf has been a member of one of the UIMCEC credit and savings unions since February, 2011.  He is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to cover traveling expenses for his children, who have to return to his native village for vacation.  This financing will enable him to ensure his family’s personal fulfillment.

loans.use: to cover traveling expenses for his children, who have to return to his native village for vacation

loans.name: Bonifacio Rafael

texts.es:
El Señor Bonifacio es policía, está trabajando como guardia de seguridad en un banco de la ciudad donde vive. Tiene su residencia en la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene pareja, la misma trabaja en un Laboratorio de análisis clínicos. Ambos, por medio de su trabajo, logran salir adelante y de esa forma pueden mantener los gastos que día a día tienen.
El señor Bonifacio es consiente de que el estudio es muy importante, por lo cual desea poder seguir capacitándose, aunque ya tenga una profesión. Es por eso que solicita el crédito, para el pago de un curso de computación, el cual le será de gran ayuda, ya que en la actualidad todo se maneja a través de las computadoras y aquel que no entiende sobre ello queda atrasado.
Sabe que a través del estudio podrá seguir creciendo también en el trabajo dentro del cuerpo de policía, ya que allí también tienen un área de computarizada. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Bonifacio is a policeman. He works as a security guard in a bank. He and his partner live in San Ignacio. She works in a clinic laboratory. They are both getting by in their jobs and are able to provide for their day to day expenses. 

Sr. Bonifacio is aware that studying is very important. Consequently he wants to be able to continue with his training, even though he already has a career. He is requesting this loan to pay for a course in computer science, which will help him greatly since nowadays everything is done through computers and those who do not understand how to use them are left behind.

He realizes that through study he will be able to continue advancing because the police also have a field of computing. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity since obtaining a loan will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to pay for a computer course

loans.name: Kuguta Kushanda Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50-year-old Marcy from Norton, about 40km from Harare. She is married, with four children ages 18, 20, 23 and 29. Three of her children are attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Marcy has been running a poultry business for 16 years. She says the main challenge she faces is bird flu which attacked the chickens during winter. Marcy has requested a loan of $300 to add layers to her stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to good schools. In the future, Marcy plans to increase the number of chickens she sells to get better profits.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Âgé de 46 ans, père  de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 5 ans est propriétaire d’une boucherie /alimentation dans le marché.
Les prêt passés lui a permis d’augmenter son activité, ces revenus journalières ont connus beaucoup d’amélioration.il a réaliser des bénéfices énormes ce qui lui a permis d’avoir un prêt important au quatrième cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il  va acheté : 5 cartons de cuisses de poulets, 5 cartons de viande arrière, 3cartonsde viande avant, 2 cartons des tripes , 2cartons de queue de bœufs,2 cartons de poulets à bouillir, 1catons de viande des porcs, 1carton de rognons, 1carton de foie de bœufs, 1sac de riz, 3packs d’eau minérales, des boites des conserves (sardine , maquerelles, petits pois , macédoines, champignons, tomates concentrées, tomates  pelées, saucisses..).
Ses ventes du jour sont de 50.000F et 150.000F et il vend beaucoup le weekend  et pendant le jour de fête
Il vend plus des viandes et des volailles que les poissons car avec le manque d’électricité il a un problème de conservation quand il y a les  coupures de courant.
Père de famille  responsable, il supporte la scolarité de ses enfants sans problèmes et depuis qu’il est a Hope, ses bénéfice lui ont aidée a finir sa maison et a y habiter, il pense qu’avec les enseignements reçus, il va réaliser son ambition : celui d’élargir son activité en ouvrant une autre boucherie / alimentation.
texts.en:
This father of a family of three children whose ages vary between 17 and five is himself aged 46 and owner of a butcher shop and grocery store in the market. 

Past loans have allowed him to grow his business. His daily revenue has greatly improved. He has made enormous profit which has allow him to request a larger fourth loan. 

With this loan he plans to buy 5 cartons of chicken thighs, 5 cartons of rump steaks, 3 cartons of other beef, 2 cartons of tripe, 2 cartons of oxtails, 2 cartons of stewing hens, 1 carton of pork, one carton of kidneys, 1 carton of beef liver, 1 sack of rice, 3 packages of mineral water, and tinned food (sardines, mackerel, peas, mixed vegetables, mushrooms, tomato paste, peeled tomatoes, sausages, etc.) 

 
His daily sales total 50,000 to 150,000 francs and he sells a lot on the weekends and holidays. He sells more meat and chicken than fish since when there are power outages he has a hard time preserving food.

A responsible father, he pays the school fees for his children with problem and since he has been with Hope, his profit has allowed him to finish his house and live in it. He thinks that with the training he has received, he is going to achieve his dream: expanding his business and opening up another butcher shop and grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cartons of meat, tripe, stewing chickens and chicken thighs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food items to resell

loans.name: Juan Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Fidel es casado, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la albañilería y a la sastrería, inició este negocio de sastrería gracias al apoyo de un familiar, tiene 6 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital y comprar materia primas par aumentar su producción, ya que en el futuro quiere tener un negocio mayor y con mejor capital.
texts.en:
Juan Fidal is married, 41 years old and has a primary school education. He has four children, three of whom are in school. He works as a mason and a tailor. He began working as a tailor thanks to the support of his family. He has six years of experience.
He is asking for this loan in order to increase his working capital and buy the basic materials needed to increase his production. In the future he would like a larger business with more income.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.name: Claudia Janeth

texts.es: Claudia Janeth desde hace 11 años, que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Ella tiene 4  hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy responsable, lo que hace la diferencia es que siempre está al pendiente con sus clientes le solicitan. Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que tiene la posibilidad de interactuar con sus clientes.
texts.en: For the past eleven years Claudia Janeth has been selling clothes for a living. She has four minor children in her care. She is always looking for a way to increase her earnings. She is a responsible woman. What makes her a good businesswoman is that she is always responsive to her customers. She is asking for this new loan in order to buy underwear, pants, blouses, skirts and suits. What she likes the most about this business is the opportunity to interact with her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and suits.

loans.name: Diattou

texts.fr: Madame Diattou est une femme mariée de 46 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce de produits alimentaires et divers tels que lait, savon. Elle exerce aussi la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a faisait partie d’un groupement qui pratiquait le commerce pendant plusieurs années. C’est ainsi que actuellement elle veuille voler de ses propres ailes. C’est surtout l’aspect lucratif de l’activité qu’elle a choisi qui l’intéresse  le plus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 fr prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires destinés a la vente. Elle veut acheter en gros pour augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.  L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Diattou is a 46-year-old married woman living in Senegal.  She works selling food items and other various items such as milk and soap.  She also sells breakfast meals.  For several years, she was part of a group of people working in sales together, and so now she wants to stand on her own two feet.  For her, the best part of this business is the profitable aspect of it.  She has been a member of one of UIMCEC’s savings and credit unions since February, 2011.  She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase food items for retail sale.  She wants to buy wholesale in order to increase her profit margin.  Increasing her profits will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food items for retail sale

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPEREMOS- CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Felicitas; tiene 46 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja atendiendo su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia  tiene en casa en la planta baja su propio negocio, ella vive en el Distrito D. San Jerónimo y es muy trabajadora, la socia desea seguir apoyando en casa a su conyugue y a sus hijos, razón por la cual la socia habre su tienda a las 6:00 a.m. espera al señor del pan que le traiga los panes frescos, acomoda toda la tienda, prepara el desayuno para todos en casa;  y como su tienda esta junto a su comedor ella no se despega D. atender la tienda y esta también atendiendo a sus hijos, la socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería, tales como arroz, harinas, aceite, leche y otros productos D. abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. productos D. abarrotes D. primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche.
En la foto estan  las dos socias; la srta. Marleni y Roxana que vinieron unos minutos despues D. comenzada la reunión con previo permiso por la tradanza.
Los otros socios del banco realizan actividades como, atención en hospedaje, en restaurante, policía nacional, artesanía, venta D. ropa.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Prosperemos- Cusco” (We Shall Prosper- Cusco) communal bank. The bank is in Huanchac District, in Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Felicitas; she is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She works in her grocery store. Felicitas has her own business on the ground floor of her house. She lives in San Jerónimo District and is very hardworking. She wants to continue supporting her husband and children at home. This is why she opens her store at 6:00 a.m. and waits for the bread man to bring her fresh bread, arranges the entire store and prepares breakfast for everyone in the house. Since her store is next to the dining room, she does not have to leave to watch the store while also taking care of her children.

Felicitas needs the loan at this time to buy basic groceries like rice, oil, sugar and milk.

In the photo there are two members, Marleni and Roxana, who arrived a few minutes after the meeting began and who had prior permission for the delay.

The other communal bank members do work like providing lodging, restaurant services, national police, handicrafts and clothing sales.

Felicitas is grateful for the support given her, and she promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries like rice, oil, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
María es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” la cual está conformada por 10 mujeres emprendedoras.
María se dedica hace mas de 2 años a la preparación y venta de tamales, donde los vende a la gente de su comunidad, pero también nos cuenta que con la ayuda de su conyugue a podido iniciar un pequeño negocio de  venta de ropa para niños, la cual  es un beneficio positivo para ella y su familia gracias a ello puede contar con un ingreso extra. La Sra. María es madre de 6 hijos y  a su  58 años de edad ha podido salir adelante y apoyado  en la  educación a sus hijos, con el préstamo que ella solicito a podido comprar insumos para su venta de tamales como maíz, carne, manteca, huevo, aceitunas. María desea terminar de construir su vivienda ya que falta techar para así poner una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer productos de primera necesidad. La Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” es un grupo responsable ya que no han tenido problemas con su pago ellos agradecen el apoyo y la confianza depositada. La sra. María del Rosario no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” Communal Bank which is made up of 10 enterprising women.

For more than 2 years, Maria has prepared and sold tamales to people in her community. She tells us that she also, with the help of her husband, has been able to start a small business selling children’s clothes, which has had a positive effect on her and her family for it has enabled her to have extra income.

Sra. Maria is the mother of 6 children and at the age of 58 has been able to get ahead and to provide for her children’s education. With the loan she is requesting she will be able to buy supplies for her sale of tamales such as corn, meat, butter, eggs and olives. 

Maria wants to finish working on her house since it needs a new roof and she also wants to have a grocery store where she can sell staples.

The “Nueva Esperanza” Communal Bank is a responsible group and they have not had any problems with payments. She is grateful for the support and the confidence placed in her. Sra. Maria del Rosario could not be present for the group photo because of work obligations.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of tamales such as corn, meat, butter and olives.

loans.name: Marys Aminta

texts.es: La señora Marys Aminta comprara más de su mercancía que es ropa para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella es madre soltera vive con su hijo de 16 año. Afirma la señora, que gracias a la atención que ella brinda a sus clientes, ahora ellos le encargan más cosas, lo que hace que ella gane más Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, trajes, camisolas y faldas. Por lo que sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marys Aminta will buy more of her merchandise - clothing - to meet her customers' demands. She is a single mother living with her 16 year old son. She tells us that thanks to the service that she gives her customers, they now order more things from her which helps her to earn more money. She started this business because she didn't have a way to survive and couldn't find work. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of underwear, pants, blouses, dresses, suits, camisoles and skirts. She dreams of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, blouses, dresses, suits, camisoles and skirts.

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: Julia Narda se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, esta no es la primera vez que ha solicitado financiamiento ya que se siente muy contenta de realizar este medio de vida. Es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su medio de vida y de compartir con sus clientes los diferentes productos que le solicitan como es cremas, tratamientos, pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, perfumes, entre otras cosas. Sueña desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Julia Narda sells cosmetics. This is not the first time that she has requested a loan and she is very happy with this way of life. She is a very responsible person who enjoys her lifestyle and sharing different products with her customers that they request, like creams, treatments, nail polish, lipstick, perfumes and other things. She dreams of increasing her business by purchasing more up-to-date merchandise that can satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy creams, treatments, nail polish, lipstick, perfumes and other things.

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es:
Don Wilder es comerciante, hoy en dia tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia y juegos de nintendo, en donde es el medio para mantener a su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, tiene cinco años ya, trabajando de esta forma, solo comenzo con la pulperia y ahora con las ganancias y financiamiento en Afodenic, se ha desarrollado mas.
Es a traves del prestamo que comienza ah introducir mas productos, aumentan la ventas, asi como los juegos de nintendo, cubriendo mas los gastos de la familia y cumpliendo con los compromisos de pago. Estando contento  por que ha logrado el equilibrio.
Con este nuevo prestamo sera para introducir mas granos basicos, golosinas, carne, pollo, gaseosas, productos lacteos, caja de jabon, axe, cloro, entre otros productos que son demandado.
texts.en:
Wilder is a merchant. Today his has his own business, a small corner store and Nintendo games, which are his main way of supporting his family. He has a wife and two children. He has been in this business for 5 years, starting first with just the corner store. Now with the earnings and loans from Afodenic he has been able to add more. 

Because of the loans he has begun to introduce more products and increase sales, like with the Nintendo games. This will cover more of his family's costs and allow him to make his payments. He is happy because he has reached this balance. 

The new loan will be used to buy more grains, snacks, meat, chicken, sodas, dairy products, soap, detergent, bleach and other products that are in high demand.

loans.use: to buy grains, snacks, meat, chicken, sodas and other things to increase sales.

loans.name: Luis Simeon

texts.es: El Señor Luis Simeón su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa. El es un padre responsable, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 14 y 18 años de edad. El negocio lo inicio porque en su negocio anterior tenia perdidas, pero fue así que el logro aprender  a administrar mejor el que tiene actualmente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de camisetas, faldas, trajes, vestidos, pantalones entre otros. El obstáculo que ha vencido ha sido el conseguir financiamiento que gracias a él podrá comprar la materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en: Luis Simeón’s business consists in clothing sales.  He’s a responsible father; he has three children who are 10, 14 and 18 years of age.  He started the business because he suffered losses in his previous business but he learned how to run his present business better.  He is asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, skirts, suits, dresses and pants, among others.  The obstacle he’s overcome is getting financing because thanks to it he’ll be able to buy raw materials necessary for his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el octavo ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos para sus familias e hijos, pero más allá de lo económico, también les gustaría ir creciendo en lo personal y como grupo. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Emiliana, ella tiene 3 hijos todos mayores, está casada y su marido tiene un sueldo fijo como empleado. Ella tiene un kiosko en su domicilio, en el cual trabaja todo el día, comenta que tiene muchas ganancias ya que es un negocio rentable, desea poder seguir con el negocio e ir agrandándolo de manera gradual. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, cigarrillos y demás que vende en su kiosko ya que siempre tiene mucha demanda. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, ya que de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnacion, and arose as a result of promotions carried out in the area. The group is in its eighth loan cycle and has been working with La Fundacion since 2008. They got together with the intention of generating a better income for their families and children, but beyond financial matters they would also like to keep growing personally and as a group. 

One of the group members is Emiliana. She has three children, all grown, she is married, and her husband is a salaried employee. She has a kiosk in her home where she works all day. She says she earns good money, and now that it's a profitable business she'd like to be able to continue with it and gradually make it grow. 

She is asking for the loan to buy juices, sodas, cigarettes and other things that she sells in her kiosk since there is always a lot of demand for them. She has high hopes for this loan since receiving it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy juice, sodas, cigarettes, and so on to supply her kiosk.

loans.name: Cherli

texts.es: Cherli, de 37 años es una mujer muy activa, siempre esta buscando alguna actividad que realizar para así poder generar ingresos para la educación de sus tres hijos con quienes vive junto a su pareja en casa de su madre.El trabajo de Cherli consiste en la compra y venta de joyas de plata y oro, además de la compra y venta de ropa, ella envía dinero a la ciudad de Lima, de ahí le envían los productos que ella se encarga de vender en la ciudad entre sus amigas y vecinas, lleva ya con este trabajo un promedio de nueve años, lo realiza sola y tiene una muy buena cartera de clientes.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder estar realizando otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que a veces las personas se demoran en pagar, pero siempre tiene clientes y lo bueno es que como ya tiene años en el negocio sabe a quien dar y a quien no, a Cherli le gustaría mas adelante poder poner una tienda da platería y oro en la ciudad.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Cherli y la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de trabajar con nosotros y espera poder seguir haciéndolo, además se siente a gusto con su grupo ya que siempre se muestran preocupados de los demás.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, ella comprara mas joyas, para así poder seguir realizando su trabajo y poder generar mas ganancias e ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Cherli, 37, is a very active woman; she’s always looking for something to do to generate income for her three children’s education.  She lives with her spouse and children in her mother’s house.  

Cherli’s work consists in buying and selling silver and gold jewelry.  She’s also a clothing merchant.  She sends money to the city of Lima and the products she orders are sent to her from there and then she sells them among her friends and neighbors in the city.  She’s been in this business on average nine years.  She works alone and has quite a good customer base.  What she enjoys the most about it is that it leaves her with time to do other things.  What she dislikes about it is that sometimes people take their time to repay her but she always has customers and since she’s been in business for a long time she knows who she can give credit to and who she can’t.  Later on, Cherli would like to be able to open a silver and gold shop in the city.

This is the fourth loan between Cherli and MFP.  She is very happy to work with us and hopes to continue to do so.  Besides, she feels very comfortable with her group because they are always concerned about each other.  She will use the requested 1500 soles to buy more jewelry to continue doing her work and generating more profits and income for her home.

loans.use: to get more jewelry.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo D. la Ciudad D. Encarnación, surgió por contacto D. una D. las integrantes con la fundación, el mismo opera con la Fundación desD. el año 2010. Ellas se organizaron y D. allí surgió el comité denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras, actualmente tiene 10 integrantes, donD. todas trabajan D. forma activa y siempre dentro D. un ambiente D. respeto y cooperación.
Una D. las integrantes del grupo es la Señora Estefana, es casada, tiene un hijo, su marido es chofer y ella se dedica hace vaR. años a la venta D. cosméticos en forma ambulante, por su barrio y también por el centro D. la ciudad. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran D. ella, dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por ayudarle a su marido en la casa y también por darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cosméticos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda en los proyectos que tiene.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación came about through one of the members’ contact with the Fundación. They have been working with the Fundación since 2010. They organized themselves and from there came about the communal bank called Mujeres Trabajadores [Working Women]. Currently the group has 10 members, everyone actively working, always in an atmosphere of respect and cooperation.

One of the members of the group is Estefana. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and she has worked some years selling cosmetics in her neighborhood and also in the center of the city. She says that she has many clients that always buy from her and she says that all her efforts go towards helping her husband in the house and also towards providing a better future for her child.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase cosmetics as she already has many orders and she would like to satisfy her clients. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her because getting a loan will be very helpful in the endeavors that she has.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Auralila

texts.es: Gloria Auralila tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y refrescos. Tiene 7 años en su negocio, cuando su esposo quien trabajaba en la empresa san Antonio le consiguió un permiso y ella estableció su negocio aquí. Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que disfrutan todos los días los productos que realiza. El motivo del crédito es para invertir en la compra de bolsas, pajillas, frutas, azúcar, gaseosas, pan y otros productos.
texts.en: Gloria Auralila, 49, sells food and soft-drinks.  She’s been in business seven years.  When her husband worked for the San Antonio firm he got her a permit and she set up the business here.  Currently, she has a large number of customers who enjoy the products she prepares daily.  The reason for the loan is to purchase bags, straws, fruit, sugar, soft-drinks, bread and other products.

loans.use: to buy bags, straws, fruit, sugar, soft-drinks, bread and other products.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora bisutería artesanal como por ejemplo anillos, pulseras, collares, brazalete y pendientes, ella realiza sus productos a pedido del cliente.  Ya son 9 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambre, mostacillones, perlas, villa y otras cosas más. 

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Leonarda was born in the community of Amaru in the city of Pisaq (Perú).  She’s 35 years old and is in a common law relationship; she has four children.  At present, she lives in the city of Pisaq where she carries out her activities.  She has a small workshop at home where she makes artisanal jewelry like rings, bracelets, necklaces, arm bands and pendants.  She makes the items on order for her customers.  Leonarda needs the loan to buy materials like wire, beads, pearls, and other supplies.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meets every thirty days in Pisaq District, Calca Province (Cusco, Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food such as maize, rice, beans & cassavas

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Señor Rodolfo es de Ciudad del Este, está casado con la Señora Ramona hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos menores los cuales van a la escuela. 
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados, además de los ahorros que tienen. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, que día a día concurren hasta su negocio, esto le genera muy buenos ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en su local. El trabajo que realiza es por darle a su familia lo mejor, para que sus hijos no tengan privaciones.
En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, jabones, y otros. El ya tuvo otros créditos con Fundación Paraguaya y los cumplió en forma excelente. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que se le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo and his wife, Sra. Ramona, have lived in Ciudad del Este for several years.  They have 4 young children, all in school.  
Rodolfo and Ramona operate a general store in a room of their house, in a neighborhood with a lot of foot traffic.  The started the business with their own money, saved from jobs that they had before.  Rodolfo says that they have a lot of customers who come to the store day in and day out.  He's pleased with the progress of the business and wants to grow it.  He works to support his family and provide them with a better life.  He doesn't want his children to go without anything that they might need.  
Rodolfo will use the loan to buy merchandise for the business: sugar, rice, soap, etc.  He has borrowed from Fundacion Paraguaya twice before and has an excellent payment record.  He is grateful for this loan because it will help his business a lot.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Yadira tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 8 años, la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. ella tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo, siempre se ha hecho responsable por proporcionarle las cosas más básicas, a pesar de que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios quiere que su hija logra ser una profesional. Este crédito es para la compra de  perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en: Yadira has had a business selling general merchandise for over 8 years.  The experience she’s acquired in business has been reassuring.  Most of her customers always request a wide variety of merchandise from her.  She has four children but only one is still dependent on her.  She’s always been responsible for providing them with the basics. Even though she was unable to finish her schooling she wants her daughter to become a professional.  This loan is to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.use: to buy perfume, footwear, clothes in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Trinidad Lisette

texts.es: Walter de 39 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su negocio porque a su esposa le brindaron un permiso para trabajar como taxista, fue así que el decide hacerse cargo del negocio En la actualidad trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de noche juntos han sabido sacar adelante su negocio y siempre brindar el mejor servicio.  Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, focos, espejos y otras reparaciones. cabe señalar que quien conduce el taxi es su esposo Walter Enrique, ya que fue Doña Trinidad que adquirio el permiso y el vehiculo y es ella quien administra el negocio.
texts.en: Trinidad Lisette, 39, is a hardworking man who started his business because his wife, Trinidad Lisette, received a permit to start working as a taxi triver. He then decided to take over the business. Currently she works every day from 6am to 10pm and together they have made the business successful and always provide good service. This loan is to buy tires, headlights, mirrors and other repairs. It is worth mentioning that the husband of Trinidad is the driver of the taxi, since she got the permits and takes care of the administrative side of the business.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlights, mirrors and other repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing and various products.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa se dedica a la venta de productos varios desde hace más de 20 años, vende frijoles cosidos, leña, leche y posicles. Es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y muy orgullosa de sus raíces. Tiene su familia, por lo que siempre esta preocupándose por brindarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, leña y leche pues tiene una gran demanda de parte de sus clientes.  Desea poder seguir adelante con su medio de vida que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
María Teresa has sold various products for over 20 years.  She sells cooked beans, firewood, milk and popsicles.  She is a very hardworking person who is devoted to her family and very proud of her roots.  She has her family and is always concerned to provide them with everything they need.  

The requested loan is to buy beans, firewood and milk because she has quite a bit of customer demand.  She wants to be able to continue with her means of earning a livelihood which is the most important thing.

loans.use: to buy beans, firewood and milk.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye est un jeune habitant du Sénégal. Il est ag é de 28 ans et a une double activité. C’est un maçon  qui pratique aussi l’aviculture qu’il a hérité de son oncle qu’il aidait  souvent. Il a une expérience de 5 ans dans ses activités. Il est surtout intéressé  par l’aspect lucratif de ces activités qui lui permettent  d’arrondir ses fins de mois. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2005. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 fr prévu pour l’achat d’aliments destiné a renforcer le poids de ses sujets a abattre a a vendre pendant la fête de korité. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer ses gains financiers.
texts.en: Mr. Mbaye is a young Senegalese man.  He is 28 years old and does two types of work.   He is a mason who also raises poultry, a business he inherited from his uncle, whom he often helped.  He has five years of experience in this area.  He is interested, above all, in the profits to be made which allow him to make ends meet at the end of the month.  He has been a member of the U-IMCEC since June of 2005.  He is requesting a credit of 200,000 FR to buy feed to put weight on the chickens which he prepares for cooking to be sold at the festival of Korité.  This loan will allow him to increase his income.

loans.use: to by feed

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Félix se dedica a brindar el servicio de soldadura y pintura. Hace más de 9 años que tiene esta actividad el posee un negocio en donde brinda el servicio de pinturas y soldaduras, pues también brinda el servicio a domicilio, tiene ciertos clientes que le realizan diferentes pedidos y Félix se encarga de realizar muy buenos servicios. El crédito es para la compra de herramienta, pinturas, spray, guantes, lentes entre otros.
texts.en: Félix provides welding and painting services.  He’s been in this line of work for over 9 years.  He has a business where he provides welding and painting services but he also does work in customers’ homes.  He has certain customers that place various orders with him and Félix makes sure to do very good jobs.  The loan is to purchase tools, paint, spray paint, gloves and goggles, among others.

loans.use: to buy tools, paint, spray paint, gloves and goggles, amont others.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer se conformó mediante la iniciativa de una de las miembros, quien ya había participado del programa en otro grupo, quien luego de una comunicación con la asesora para la formación de un nuevo grupo, logró juntar a 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad, ellas se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Ilda se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, los cual le genera un buen ingreso. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo ha logrado mantenerse y mantener a su familia, ya que por medio de su esfuerzo quiere darles un mejor estilo de vida sin privaciones. Una de sus metas es tener un local para vender las ropas que tiene. En cuanto a su clientela dice que tiene muchas ventas y pedidos con los cuales quiere cumplir. Por eso es que solicita el crédito, para que por medio de este pueda comprar más prendas de estación y de esa forma cumplir con lo demandado por sus clientes.
Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta el da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The committee of women named "Renacer" ("To Be Reborn"), came about on the initiative of one of the members, who had participated in the program as part of another group.  After a discussion with the counselor about forming a new group, she brought together 20 women, who are all friends and neighbors in the city. They work together in the program with a lot of pleasure and much effort and care, in a cooperative and mutually supportive way.

Señora Ilda works selling all types of clothing, which earns her a good income.  She comments that thanks to this work she has been able to support herself and her family, and that through her efforts she wants to provide her family with a better style of life without deprivations.

One of her goals is to have some premises to sell her clothes.  As for her customers, she says that she has many sales and orders that she wants to fulfill.

For this reason, she is requesting the loan so that she can use it to be able to buy more seasonal clothing, and in this way meet her customers' demand.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it's giving her, as obtaining the loan will be a great help to her in her undertakings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del socorro tiene un negocio que es una pulpería, hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio con capital propio ya que su esposo le brindó apoyo ya que él se dedica a un taller de electricista fue así que Vicenta decide iniciar su negocio ella ofrece granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, detergentes, cerrillos, cigarrillos y papel higiénico. Es por eso que Vicenta recurre al apoyo de los créditos para comprar lo que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en: Vicenta Del Socorro’s business is a grocery store.  She’s had the store for over 16 years.  She started out with capital of her own since her husband helped her out; he works at an electrician’s workshop.  Vicenta decided to start a business.  She stocks basic grains, soup, canned goods, detergent, matches, cigarettes and toilet paper.  This is why Vicenta is calling upon help from loans: to buy what her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es comerciante, desde hace tres años, puso una pequeña pulperia, para el apoyo de su familia, casada, y madre de seis hijos. Su esposo labora como conductor.
Al inicio comenzo con ahorros que su esposo dio, luego comienza a introducir mercaderia con financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde su demanda aumento y su clientela.
De sus seis hijos, cuatro estan casados y a dos da estudio, que espera apoyar para un mejor futuro.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: granos basicos, en arroz, frijoles, azucar, caja de jabon, axe, cajillas de huevos, productos de limpieza, caja de naturas, caja de tang, entre otros que son muy demandados. Manteniendo a sus clientes sastifechos, asi como ventas altas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a merchant.  She opened a small grocery store three years ago to help support her family.  She’s married and the mother of six children.  Her husband works as a driver.  At the beginning she worked with her husband’s savings but then started adding more merchandise thanks to Afodenic loans when her clientele and demand grew.  Of her six children, four are married and she provides schooling for the other two and hopes to provide them with a better future.

She will use this new loan to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, a box of soap, Axe detergent, boxed eggs, cleaning supplies, a box of Naturas fruit juice, a box of Tang, among others that are in high demand keeping her customers satisfied as well as sales high.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more electronics to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell cosmetics from catalogs.

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es: El señor Heliodoro es habitante de La Concepción Masaya , junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindar una vida digna a sus hijos y nieto s  , don Heliodoro es un pequeño agricultor de piña desde hace varios años , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ya que estas carecen de fertilizantes e insumos para combatir  malezas , lo cual si no induce a tiempo puede ocasionar pérdida total de la producción , Agradece el apoyo  que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva  para que pueda comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios y lograr una producción de calidad .
texts.en:
Sr. Heliodoro lives in La Concepción Masaya with his wife and children. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and to provide a decent life for his children and grandchildren. Don Heliodoro is a small-scale farmer who has been growing pineapple for several years. The greatest challenge he has faced is dealing with pests that invade his crops. He also lacks fertilizers and other supplies for combating weeds, which can cause a total loss of production if not dealt with in time.

Heliodoro is grateful for the assistance AFODENIC has provided by making Kiva funds available. He plans to buy fertilizers and the necessary supplies to achieve production that is of good quality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farmings supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy precious stones, fine silver, Swarovski crystal, and other items for making jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes through catalogs.

loans.name: Nonvignon E Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON E est un groupement constitué de quatorze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Akoko Delphine. Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement et d'élargir leur activité, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Akoko Delphine est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un certain Négniwoé. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Akoko Delphine et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Il y a près de trente ans que Akoko Delphine mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Akoko Delphine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Akoko Delphine et aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON E, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON E is a group made up of 14 people who all live in the same district in Benin. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and grow their business activity.
The group´s leader (the woman in the picture with her hand raised) is called Akoko Delphine. She is 50 years old and is married to Négniwoé. The couple has one dependent child and 3 children in all, all of whom go to school. Akoko Delphine and her husband both contribute to the various household expenses. Akoko Delphine has sold food products from her home for nearly 30 years, an activity which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies at the market.
This loan would enable Akoko Delphine and the NONVIGNON E group to increase their business levels, pull in more customers and make greater profits.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es: Gerónima esperanza tiene 65 años su actividad es la venta de tortillas hace más de 43 años que tiene esta actividad. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento por lo que es una buena clienta y realiza sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es los problemas de salud que tiene pues tiene que levantarse desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche. El objetivo del crédito es para la compra de leña, cal, comal, bolsas entre otros.
texts.en:
Gerónima Esperanza is 65 years old and has been selling tortillas for more than 43 years. This is not the first time she has received financing since she has been a good client and has completed her payments on time and according to terms. One of the major challenges that she must deal with is her health problems. Gerónima wakes up early and works from 6am to 6pm.

Her plans for this loan are to buy firewood, lime, a metal hotplate, bags, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, a metal hotplate, bags, and other supplies for making tortillas.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Doña Elba tiene 55 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, comenta que se dedica a la compra de trajes de hombre como de smoking, cadetes, frac, traje normal etc. dice que a ella le llena de emoción cada vez que van a rentarle los trajes a las quinceañeras ya que le gusta ver a las chicas la cara de emoción por su fiesta y el ver a sus chambelanes muy bien cambiados, dice que su negocio le deja muchas satisfacciones ver tanta alegría en la caras de los clientes, doña Elba tiene con su negocio desde hace 20 años, hace poco dice que se asocio con su nuera y su hijo para poder hacer mas grande la tienda y comprar mas trajes. Dice que esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de tela de diferentes colores para mandar hacer las corbatas, los moños, fajin, compra de pantalones, camisas blancas etc. dice que quiere hacer un poco mas grande el local ya que no cabe la mercancía ahí y tiene que rentar otro local para guardar la ropa que renta. Ella ira a la ciudad de México a comprar las telas, los pantalones y mandara hacer los moños y las demás cosas en diferentes tallas.
texts.en:
Doña Elba is 55 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She says that she buys men’s outfits such as smoking jackets, cadet uniforms, tuxedo tails, regular suits, and other items. Elba says that she is filled with emotion every time she rents out outfits for “quinceañeras” because she enjoys seeing the excitement on the faces of young girls as they plan their parties and helping their chamberlains (the attendants at the ceremony) transform into well-dressed young men. She takes great satisfaction in seeing the joy on her customers’ faces. Doña Elba has been in this business for 20 years. She says that just recently she partnered with her daughter-in-law and her son to enlarge her shop and buy more outfits.

Elba says that she is requesting a loan to buy fabric in different colors for making ties, bows, sashes, trousers, white shirts, and other items. She says that she wants to make her shop larger because she cannot keep all of her merchandise there. Another space has been rented so that she can store her rental outfits. Elba plans to travel to Mexico City to buy the fabrics for making trousers. The bows and other items will be made by other shops.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making men's suits that will be rented out for events.

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 37 años de edad, ella es originaria de una localidad rica en cultura e historia, ella es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 9 años de edad el cual estudia la primaria y el orgullo de ella ya que es un buen deportista seleccionado en futbol de su escuela. Doña Rocío tiene una tienda de abarrotes en casa de su mama desde hace cinco años, dice que abrió su negocio para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos de la casa ya que le dan permiso de vivir ahí con su hijo, ella esta pidiendo un crédito en la financiera para comprar artículos para su tienda de abarrotes como leche, huevo, aceite, arroz, dulces, refrescos, galletas, enlatados etc. ella surte ese tipo de productos en diferentes tiendas de su localidad donde le dan precios baratos para después ella ganarle algo a los productos que vende en su tienda de abarrotes. La meta que tiene la señora Rocío es tener mejor surtida su tienda para que sus vecinos no se trasladen hasta el centro de la localidad para que no gasten en trasportes y ella tenga ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocío is 37 years old and originally from a town that is rich in culture and history. She is a single mother and has a nine-year-old son who is in elementary school. Doña Rocío has managed a grocery store at her mother’s house for the past five years. She said that she started this business in order to help her parents with the household expenses since they have allowed her and her son to live with them.

Rocío is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy products for her grocery store such as milk, eggs, oil, rice, candy, soft drinks, cookies, canned goods, and other items. She acquires these types of products from different stores in her town where the prices are lower. This allows her to earn some profit when she sells these items in her grocery store. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store so that her neighbors do not have to travel to the central part of town. They save on transportation costs and she is able to earn some profit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús es un hombre muy trabajador el tiene 41 años de edad y es originario de una población rica en cultura y hermoso en paisajes, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos uno estudia la secundaria y la menor la primaria. El tiene un taxi el cual da servicio en su población desde hace 6 años, dice que le costo mucho trabajo obtener su taxi ya que son muchos requisitos para obtener un permiso pero el es una persona muy constante y de “fe”, y gracias a Dios obtuvo su permiso através de muchos sacrificios.
