What she likes most about her work is that she manages her own time.  In addition, she mentions that she loves what she does, as she grew up doing this work.  She also feels that it is very profitable, as she always has customers, and also sells to several stores in the city.  

Now she is hoping to be able to start selling food in the evenings, and this is one of the goals she wants to accomplish.

This is Isidora's seventh loan with the MFP institution.  She feels good about the group, and that everyone has been responsible so far.  She is very grateful that the institution gives her the opportunity to feel useful, and above all productive.

With the amount requested of 1,000 Soles, she hopes to be able to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials to make baskets.

loans.name: Zita Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Zita, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  25, 20 y 18 años de edad, los tres estudian en universidad y aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro constructor. Ella aprendió hace varios años corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y a confeccionar ropa en su casa, tiene  una maquina de coser en la cual confecciona ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niños, nos cuenta que ella combina ambas actividades ya que al mismo tiempo que sus clientes llegan para que les confeccione prendas de vestir también aprovecha para vendeles la ropapor catalogo, a veces también recorre por el lugar por donde vive. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 21h00 cuando tiene ropa que elaborar. Lleva más de 15 años en sus actividades y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta porque los interese son muy bajos en relación a otros bancos.

Su sueño es tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the members of the Ave Fénix Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here, we meet Sra. Zita, 49, who is married and has three children, ages 25, 20 and 18. The three study at the university and still live with her. Her husband is a master builder. Several years ago she learned tailoring in an academy in Portoviejo.

She works selling clothes by catalog and that she makes in her home. She has a sewing machine to make clothing, particularly for women and children. She tells us that she combines both activities, for when her customers come to her to have clothes made, she also takes the opportunity to sell them clothing by catalog. She also sometimes canvasses her neighborhood. She works everyday from 8:30 a.m. until 9 p.m. when she has clothes to make. She has spent more than 15 years in this work and she is doing very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been in the Communal Bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are very low compared to other banks.

Her dream is to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Santa María està integrado por dos socias, Rosa Etelvina y Betulia Etelvina, ambas son familiares. Las dos socias viven en la Colonia Santa María en Juticalpa, Olancho. Antes habia otra socia pero se atrasaba en el pago de sus cuotas. 

Sra. Rosa Etelvina tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 7 hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo. Empezó su negocio con una chiclera pero la ganancia era poca y decidió cambiar de negocio a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Invertirá el préstamo en materia prima como maíz y leña para aumentar su producción de tortillas y sus ganancias. Con las ganancias podrá mejorar la alimentación y educación de su familia. La Sra. Rosa Etelvina sueña con poder ampliar su casa y hacerle unas mejoras porque está bastante deteriorada. Ha sido un buen cliente de FAMA y siempre ha pagado puntualmente. Agradece la confianza y el apoyo brindado por FAMA, ya que a traves de los préstamos ha superado momentos difíciles. 

Sra. Betulia Etelvina tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo. Con su hijo tiene un negocio de reparación y servicio de computadoras. También se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y la venta de agua purificada. Con el préstamo de 3,000 Lempiras comprará componentes de computadoras, ropa de segunda mano y agua purificada. Con el apoyo del préstamo su negocio será más amplio y sus ganancias aumentarán. El sueño de Sra. Betulia Etelvina es que su hijo siga su educación en la universidad.
texts.en: hdhf

loans.use: Comprar maiz y leña

loans.name: Nancy Natividad

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 55 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es taxista. 

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de varias marcas como Nivi y Leonisa, además de productos de Sayson y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de lunes a viernes por las tardes, nuestra amiga se va dos veces al mes hasta Libertad a vender sus productos pues dice que allá tiene muchos clientes a quienes le deja regularmente y a quienes vende al contado. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende es la ropa intima de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 11 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son seguir con sus ventas ya que esto es su vida.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years past as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix Bird) communal bank meet every two weeks.

Nancy, 55, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are all adults now but two still live at home.  Her husband’s a taxi driver.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, sells clothes via catalogue of the Nivi and Leonisa brands.  She also sells Sayson and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works afternoons Monday through Friday.  Twice a month our friend goes all the way to Libertad to sell her products because she says she has many customers there that buy regularly and pay cash.  She’s been in this business for seven years and does very well.  What she most sells is intimate wear for women which is highly sought after by the ladies.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank for 11 years and likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to continue selling because that’s her life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Sonia Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos mayores de edad y dos de ellos estudian en universidad,  el menor tiene 13 años el cual estudia en colegio, Su esposo es sastre.

Nuestra amiga trabaja junto al esposo en el taller de costura que ellos tienen en el centro de la ciudad, ellos confeccionan ropa de hombre como pantalones, camisas y ternos en cualquier modelo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00 que cierran su local pero en muchas ocasiones el trabajo no termina allí ya que en casa ellos siguen realizando sus obras cuando tienen mucho que entregar, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que llevan más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad y que a pesar de que la ropa industrializada llega mucho ellos tienen suficientes clientes que prefieren confeccionar sus prendas en su loca.

Este crédito es para comprar material de costura como hilos, telas, cierres, botones entre otras cosas. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede colaborar más con el negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the "Ave Fénix" (The Phoenix) communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees".

Sonia, is 50, married, and has 5 children; 4 of them are adults, and 2 are at university. The youngest is 13, and in high school.  Her husband is a tailor. Our friend works alongside her husband in the tailoring shop they own in the center of the city. They make men's clothing, such as pants, shirts and suits in any pattern.

They work every day from 8:00am to 7:00pm when they close their shop; but often the work doesn't finish there, since at home they keep working when they have a big order to complete.  Our friend tells us that she has done this work for more than 20 years, and that in spite of all the mass-produced clothing that is available, they have enough customers who prefer to have their clothes made in her shop. 

This loan is to buy materials for sewing such as thread, fabric, zippers, bottons, and other things.  She has been with the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it, because thanks to the loans, she is able to contribute more to the business.  Her dream is to move forward in life and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, thread, bottons, etc.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fanny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  12 y 4 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Nuestra amiga lleva en el Banco Comunal 10 Años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos tiene su negocio en el que se gana la vida sin tener que salir de su casa y descuidar a sus hijos.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa en el que vende tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, además de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También vende helados, sodas y cervezas, trabaja todos los días ya que como su negocio lo tiene en casa no se le hace difícil estar al tanto de su negocio y su hogar, solo a veces en las noches ella se va a ofrecer sus productos por el lugar donde vive aprovechando que su esposo ya está en casa, lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad y nos cuenta que a pesar de la crisis le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas.
 
Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Ave Fénix Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is the place where we meet Fanny, age 40.  She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 4.  The oldest goes to school.  Her husband is a merchant.  Our friend has been in the communal bank for ten years.  She likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has her business.  The business is her way of earning a living without leaving the house or neglecting her children.

She sells rechargeable phone plans and calling cards at the store she has in her house.  She also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She also sells ice cream, soda, and beer.  She works every day.  As her business is in her house, it is not difficult for her to keep track of her business and her home.  Only sometimes she goes to sell her products at night in the place where she lives, taking advantage of the fact that her husband is at home.  She has been doing this for five years.  She tell us that in spite of the crisis it is going well for her.

The loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, phone plans, and calling cards.

Her dream is to have a grocery store that has everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, phone plans, and calling cards.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meats, chicken, cured meats, soft-drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Flor Narcisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene años 53 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella viven dos nietos de 11 y 3 años que son de un compromiso de uno de sus hijos y que son como sus hijos el mayor estudia en escuela.
 
Nuestra amiga comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo, el comercio y el cuidado a sus nietos, ella es maestra en una escuela de la localidad y además de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, nos cuenta que la mayoría de los padres de familia de la escuela en donde imparte sus conocimientos son sus clientes, allí también les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo, ella vende de lunes a viernes medio día ya que en las tardes y fines de semana  les dedica todo el tiempo a sus queridos nietos. Lleva 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad comercial.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque con su primer crédito empezó con su negocio. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio y con sus queridos nietos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years past as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix Bird) communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met Flor, 53, here.  She’s a single mother of two children who are adult and independent.  Her two grandchildren, who are 11 and 3 years old and are the children of one of her sons, live with her and they are like children of her own; the oldest is in school.

Our friend divides her time between her job, commerce and caring for her grandchildren.  She’s a teacher at a local school but she also sells all sorts of clothes.  She tells us that most of the parents of children where she teaches are her customers.  She also sells to her coworkers there.  She sells half days from Monday through Friday because afternoons and weekends are dedicated full time to her beloved grandchildren.  She’s been doing her commercial activity for 8 years.

She’s going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  Her dream is to continue forward with her business and with her beloved grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene años 42 de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 26, 15 y 11 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos pudo seguir adelante en su negocio y con esto poder sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es padre y madre a la vez.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y productos naturales de varias marcas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque ya tiene varios clientes que siempre le compran sus productos sobretodo los naturales, trabaja de lunes a viernes  en las mañanas y en las noches ya que de mañana están sus hijos en la escuela y en la noche están en casa sus clientes. Lleva cinco años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar productos naturales y sabanas.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years past as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix Bird) communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met María, 42, here.  She’s a single mother of three children who are 26, 15 and 11 years of age.  The two youngest go to secondary school and elementary school.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because thanks to the loans she’s been able to stay in business and through it was able to raise her children since she’s both father and mother at the same time.

Our friend’s a merchant selling sheets and natural products of different brands.  She sells door to door although she has several customers that always buy her products, especially the natural ones.  She works Monday through Friday both mornings and evenings because in the morning her children are at school and at evening her customers are home.  She’s been in this line of work that she’s raised her children with for five years.

She will use this loan to buy natural products and sheets.  Her dream is to see her children become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy natural products and sheets.

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Susana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es cómico.
 
Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda general en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como víveres, artículos de bazar, ciertas medicinas, además de productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Tiene más de diez años con su negocio y le va muy bien, cada día aumenta sus productos para dar lo mejor a sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos Avon, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener la mejor tienda de su barrio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, Manabí's capital, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Ave Fénix"(The Phoenix) hold a meeting every two weeks.
 
This is where we meet Señora Susana.  She is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband has two children who are 15 and 11 years old.  The children both go to school.  Her husband is a comedian.
 
Our friend has a general store in her home.  She sells all types of products in her store, such as provisions, convenience items, some medicines and Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  Señora Susana works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with her store when they aren't busy.  She has been running her store for more than ten years, and it's going very well for her.  Every day she increases her stock to be able to give the best to her customers.

This loan will be used to stock up her store even more.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oils and Avon products, among other things.  Señora Susana has been with her communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because the loans have enabled her to improve her business.

Señora Susana hopes to have the best store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, Avon products etc.

loans.name: Luz Radiante Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. Vilma de 47 años de edad, soltera  con 02 hijos menores de edad en etapa escolar, es una de las 13 socias que conforman  L. Alcancía Comunal Luz Radiante, todos los integrantes del anterior ciclo  demostraron ser puntuales  con las cuotas de sus pagos. Vilma se dedica  a L.  venta de abarrotes al por mayor y menor, se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda y dedicarse primero a L. limpieza, ordenar y seleccionar L. mercadería.  Anteriormente se dedicaba  a L.  venta de comida, pero  al parecer en este negocio no le fue muy bien, ya que  el dinero que ganaba  no le alcanzaba para alimentar a sus hijos. Solicita este préstamo para L. compra de mercadería  y así surtir su tienda para obtener más ingresos y dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida  .El deseo de Vilma en el futuro es que sus hijos logren ser profesionales.
En L. foto Vilma se encuentra ubicada  al centro, viste  una chompa color  blanco , las socias que estan de fotos recortadas que se ubican al extremo de L. fotografia no llegaron en el momento que se tomo L. foto y se las tomo despues
texts.en:
Vilma, age 47, is single and has two minor, school age children.  She is one of the 13 members that comprise the “Luz Radiante” (Radiante Light) Communal Bank.  During the last cycle all of the members showed themselves to be punctual with their payments.

Velma sells wholesale and retail groceries.  She gets up very early to open her store.  First she does the cleaning, arranging, and selection of the merchandise.  Previously she sold food, but this business did not seem to go very well for her.  She did not earn enough money to feed her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, get greater income, and give her children a better quality of life.Vilma’s wish for the future is for her children to become professionals.She is in the center of the photo wearing a white sweater. The members in the smaller photos did not arrive in time for the group photo and their picture was taken afterwards.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Dangely Mabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dangely, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  6, 4 y 1 año  de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su esposo esta en el extranjero trabajando.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y a la elaboración y venta  de bisutería de todos los modelos y variedades, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque por el momento que sus hijos están pequeños mas vende en su  casa al mismo tiempo que elabora sus obras, nos cuenta que sus clientes le realizan pedidos ya que en varias ocasiones su esposo le trae o le manda mercadería de los Estados Unidos donde él vive. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene seis  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien a pesar de que tiene sus hijos pequeños que le impiden ir a otros lados a vender.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y material para elaborar bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal dos años  y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es tener un local grande y bien surtido.
texts.en:
The Women's Union Community Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Calceta, known as "Calceta, a city without equal" for the beauty of the women and because to its inhabitants there is not a more beautiful city in the world. 

This is where Mrs. Dangely lives. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, 6, 4, and 1 respectively. Her husband currently works abroad.

She works selling all types of clothes and makes and sells jewelry of many varieties. She sells door-to-door, though at the moment in order to be with her young children she sells most of her products out of her home. She also makes her jewelry there. Her clients make orders and her husband, who lives in the United States, sends them or brings them when he returns. She allows her clients to buy on credit and charges interest every 15 days. She has been running this business for six  years, and it continues to be successful despite the fact that she has to sell out of her home.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes, and materials for jewelry. She has been a member of the community bank for two years, and she likes the support offered through loans.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked big store.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, and materials for jewelry

loans.name: Nancy Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

La señora Nancy es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque a pesar del tiempo el grupo se ha hecho más unido y que es como una familia que se apoya mutuamente. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos son mayores  y el menor de 16 años que estudia en  colegio, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella, el menor y una hija que es casada junto a sus esposo y dos pequeños que son la felicidad de nuestra amiga. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
 
Ella es modista de profesión trabaja y en un taller de costura de una señora para lo cual recibe un sueldo semanal, pero en las noches ella por su cuenta se dedica a coser ropa, en especial vestidos de niñas que es lo que más le gusta confeccionar aunque también elabora bastantes prendas de damas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Lleva más de 25 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que nunca le ha faltado trabajo tanto en el taller como en su casa.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller propio con varias operarias y entregar grandes pedidos.
texts.en:
The Unión De Mujeres (Women’s Union) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known by the name “Calceta la sin par” (Unparalled Calceta) for the beauty of its women and because for its inhabitants, there is no more beautiful city in the world.  

Nancy is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because despite the time, the group has become more united and is like a family that supports each other.  She is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  Three of them are adults. The youngest is a 16 year old student, and still lives at home. Her daughter, son-in-law, and two small children, who are the joy of her life, also live with her. Her husband is a master builder.

She is a dressmaker by profession, and works for a woman in a sewing workshop for which she is paid a weekly salary.  But in the evenings, she sews clothing on her own. Mainly, she sews dresses for girls and that is what she enjoys making the most although she also makes many ladies garments as well.  She works based on orders from individuals.  She has been engaged in this activity for more than 25 years and it’s going very well since she has never lacked work in the workshop or at home.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons, and other sewing materials.  Her dream is to have her own workshop with several workers and deliver large orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasterners, etc.

loans.name: Johanna Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta (Provincia de Manabí), ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par “por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es albañil. 

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que además de ser una gran ama de casa también trabaja de auxiliar de enfermería en una clínica, también  se dedica a la elaboración de bisutería y venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también aprovecha para vender en el lugar donde trabaja, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y material para elaborar bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal  cinco años y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido para poder comprar mercadería.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en sus actividades.
texts.en:
The communal bank Unión De Mujeres meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known as “Calceta without equal" because of the beauty of the women there and because, to those who live there, no city in the world is more beautiful. 

In this city lives Johanna, who is 29 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children aged 10 and 7 years old and in school. Her husband is a mason.

She is a very hard working woman who is a housekeeper and also works as a nursing assistant in a clinic in Calceta. She also makes imitation jewelry and sells clothing through a catalogue. She makes her sales by going door to door and also takes the opportunity to make sales where she works. She gives her clients a credit and collects every 15 days. She's been operating this business for seven years and it's going very well. 
 
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, tee shirts, children's clothes, and material to make jewelry. She's been in the communal bank for 5 years and she likes it because the loans have been used to enable her to buy merchandise. 

Her dream is to progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tee shirts, children's clothes, and materials to make jewelry.

loans.name: Nelly Soraya

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, tiene 41 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación que tuvo tiene dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, los dos estudian en colegio y escuela. Nuestra amiga esta en el Banco Comunal desde que se inicio y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio que le ha permitido sacar sola a sus hijos adelante.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y así sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además en ciertas ocasiones también se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas criollas. Trabaja todos los días ya que realiza trabajos domésticos en una casa de la localidad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. 

Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
The Women's Union Community Bank meets every two weeks in the charming city of Calceta. It is known as "Calceta without equal" because of its beautiful women and because locals think there is no place more beautiful on Earth. 

Here we meet Nelly, who is 41 years old. She is separated from her spouse, but they have two children, ages 17 and 9. Both are in school. Our friend Nelly is part of the Women's Union Community Bank, which she helped found. She appreciates the loans she has received, which have allowed her to start her own business and look after her children on her own. 

Nelly is a homemaker who, in order to earn her own income and raise her children, sells clothing (via catalogue) and Yanbel merchandise (beauty products, makeup, perfume, women's accessories). She occasionally buys and sells chickens, and also works every day cleaning houses in her neighbourhood. Nelly works on credit and collects her payment each weekend. She has been doing this for 10 years and it's still going very well. 

Nelly will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, makeup and all sorts of clothing. 

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals who are also good people.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, makeup and clothing.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a loving and hardworking mother of four school-aged children. She is 42 years old and is married. Margarita’s husband is a farmer and is her partner in managing their rice farming business.

From every harvest, Margarita’s income was not still enough to finance her farm for the next crop. Her income was used to pay her children's school fees, meet their daily needs, and repay her borrowed loan from the traders --  private lenders who finance their needs in farming. 

Margarita wanted to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for farming.  She thinks that the loan will be a big help for her so she will no longer need to borrow from the traders.

loans.use: buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Grace has a shop that sells home products such as plastic and kitchen wares. Her husband provides motorela or habal-habal services. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock like home products to sell.  Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like home products to sell

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juditha has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.  Juditha has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juditha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Perlita has a shop that makes and sells hot dogs and home-made sausage like chorizzo and longganisa. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.  Perlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingrdients needed for making home-made sausage

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with three children. 
Roxanne has a pigpen and she sells grown, matured pigs.  She has had this business for three years.  Her husband provides motorela and habal-habal (transportation services).  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs she sells.
Roxanne has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Roxanne hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs she sells

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 
Gina has a food shop that makes and sells native delicacies snacks such as biko, palitaw, and banana cue.  She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items such as sweets, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, plastic products and other necessary inventory.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Jessica has a food shop or alacart that makes and sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the alacart or barbecue shop.
Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the alacart or barbecue shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old. She is married to a local farmer and together they raise four children. Mercy and her husband did not finished their education due to financial hardship. To generate income and provide support for the education of her children, they are both involved in the farming business. They plant and harvest rice and have been managing a half-hectare rice field for almost 10 years. 

Mercy wants to improve her crop production.  That is why she is requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor cost in transplanting the rice seedlings. 

In the future, with the help of this loan, she will save enough money to continuously send her children to school so they can have a degree someday to achieve a successful life.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-Ann is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mary-Ann has a food shop where she sells home-made sausages like chorizo and longaniza. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausages.

Mary-Ann is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary-Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausages.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Teresa has a food shop where she sells home-made sausages like chorizo and longaniza. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.

Teresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Virgincita has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses, & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy clothing like t-shirts & blouses. 

Virgincita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Virgincita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Mien's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five low-income villagers who have been living in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Mien is the head of this group. She is a 39-year-old married woman blessed with five children, four of whom are single and enrolled in school. The other is no longer in school and is working as a porter. 

Mrs. Mien makes her daily living by working as a carrying laborer in the local market, earning $3 a day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a porter. Mrs. Mien is seeking a loan to renovate her house.

In the future, Mrs. Mien expects that she will be using her income to buy some piglets, ducks, and chickens for breeding and to have a good house for living. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

The other four borrowers are: 
Mrs. Ren, a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair her house.
Mrs. Am, 48, who will use this loan to buy some goods to sell for more income.
Mrs. Hoat, who is applying for a loan to buy more pigs and repair her house.
Mrs. Sao, who is taking a loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Leonora has a retail shop that sells electronic loads (cell phone minutes) from different networks like Globe & Smart. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy electronic loads to sell. 

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads (mobile phone minutes) to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Mylene has a food shop that sells  barbecued chicken & hot dogs. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for the food shop. 

Mylene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mylene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food shop

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and is the owner of sari-sari (variety) store. She has had this business for four years and earns about P2,800 a month. Aside from this home-based store, she is also engaged in a direct selling business in which she sells cosmetic products, shoes, blouses and lotions.  She is a married woman with two school-aged childrenl. According to Marissa, she utilizes her profit for their daily needs and school supplies for her children.

Marissa would like to ask for a loan amounting to P25,000, which will be used to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, snack foods and ingredients for her retail shop business.  With her determination in life, she believes that she can fulfill her dream by continuing to actively maintain her business for a longer period of time.  In this regard, she will be able to put up a stall for her direct selling business and give her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: buy groceries items

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, eggs, & dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages. 

Lourdes joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.en:
Napoleon is married and has three children who are in school. He is 48 years of age and is engage in a farming business where he plants and harvests rice. Napoleon is happy living with his wife and his children, despite the financial shortage encountered by his family.

Because of the high cost of farm supplies nowadays, Napoleon is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for the production of rice. 

Napoleon is dedicated to his work because he wanted to obtain his desire -- to uplift his family out of poverty. He also does his best so he can send his children to school to finish their college education because he is guided by his belief that “education is all a matter of building bridges”.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. 

Richard has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods & snacks, and also to pay for materials needed for the renovation of his store. In the picture, Richard is working on the renovation of his store; the lumber is still to be used for the store. 

Richard has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & snacks, and to buy materials to renovate the store

loans.name: Sabina's Group

texts.en:
Sabina is a very talented lady and supports her husband by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electrical repair services to his clients. He works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. Sabina has four children. Only one of her children is able to get an education.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electrical repair tools to provide better quality services to his clients and earn more profits. He is very experienced in his work and has been doing it for many years. Sabina hopes that after the loan investment, he will be able to earn more profits. This will allow her family to live a better financial life as a result. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sabina.

loans.use: To buy tools for electrical repairs

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 38 años convive con la madre de sus dos hijos, vive en casa de su madre junto a sus dos hermanos.El trabajo de Luis es el de transportista en la ciudad de Pucallpa, sale muy temprano a buscar los eventuales pasajeros en una unidad móvil conocido como motocarro (un vehiculo de tres ruedas muy usado en la ciudad), este trabajo lo hace en las diferentes calles de la ciudad, lleva en este trabajo ya casi 8 años, y cuenta con la ayuda de su conviviente quien le espera todos los días con algunos preparados para mantener en forma sus maltratados riñones por las duras calles de la ciudad.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que  se siente independiente y puede ir a recoger a sus hijos de sus centros de estudios, siempre tiene pasajeros ya que este vehiculo es muy utilizado en la ciudad y espera poder crecer junto a su familia en cuanto a infraestructura así como en la educación de sus menores hijos.Este es el préstamo numero 7 entre ]Luis Alberto y la institución MFP, esta contento ya que esta integrando un grupo muy responsable, espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución de forma responsable como lo hizo hasta ahora y esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad y la confianza que le brinda la institución.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles el comprará piezas para el arreglo de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 38 years old, lives with the mother of his two children; they live in his mother's house, along with his two brothers. Luis' work is providing transportation in the city of Pucullpa. He goes out in his vehicle very early to look for possible passengers. His vehicle is known as a "motocarro" or motorcycle taxi. It is a vehicle with three wheels and is very commonly used in the city. He works on the various streets of the city. He has been doing this work for almost 8 years, and he has the help of his wife, who waits for him every day with something ready to help keep his kidneys in shape, since they are treated roughly by the hard streets of the city. 

What he likes about his work is that he feels independent and can go to pick up his children at their schools. He always has passengers, since his vehicle is very well used in the city, and he hopes to be able to grow, along with his family, in terms of infrastructure as well as in the education of his young sons. 

This is loan number 7 between Luis Alberto and the MFP institution. He is happy since he has joined a very responsible group. He hopes to be able to continue working with the institution in a responsible way, as he has done up to now, and he is very grateful for the opportunity and the confidence that the institution has shown in him. With the sum he has applied for, 1500 PEN, he will buy parts to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy parts to fix his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Zurakan's Group

texts.en:
Zurakan is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 years old and unfortunately is a widow. She has raised five children, all of whom are employed. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zurakan started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. The retail trade of fruits and vegetables brings her enough money to meet her daily needs. She applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to increase the commodity turnover for her business. With the money received from the loan, Zurakan will purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, with the profits gained from the business she plans to purchase a container. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Leofel

texts.en:
Leofel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Leofel has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Leofel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leofel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Here are five people who have joined together in one group for a similar purpose. All of them reside in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Chann has chosen to be a leader in the group. She has given birth to eight children, six of whom are single while the remaining two are married and living in their own houses.

Mrs. Chann and her husband are working in the same occupation: fish catching. They always go out of their house to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. The couple makes an income around $4 per day to cover their daily expenses. Mrs. Chann and her husband will use this loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so they can catch more fish.

In the prospective future, Mrs. Chann thinks that she will buy a new boat, build a comfortable house in which to live and support her children’s education.

The other borrowers are:
Mrs. Sem, a local fisherman, who is asking for loan as well. She requested a loan to buy nets to sustain her fishing activity. 

Another Mrs. Sem, a fish catcher, is borrowing a loan to purchase nets.

Mrs. Khlauk is taking a loan to buy a variety of products for selling in order to increase her income.

Another Mrs. Chann is applying for a loan to purchase nets for fishing purposes.

loans.use: to purchase nets and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Sylvia has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.   Sylvia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sylvia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON to sell

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en:
Celedonio is a determined father who wants to lift his family out of poverty. He wakes up early and goes down to the field. He manages his time wisely in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and then sell it to traders. Celedonio is 42 years old. He has three children to support which is why he spends most of his time at his business. He sacrifices a lot to ensure his crop produces an abundant harvest. 

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and pay for land cultivation. With the help of these chemicals he would maintain his farming business and yield a better crop every crop season.
 
In the future, Celedonio hopes to earn more profits for house repair.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Pregreno

texts.en:
Pregreno is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Pregreno has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Pregreno has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pregreno hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Bumalike's Group

texts.en:
Bumalike is the leader of this group. She is 52 and is married to a welder. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and four sons. Her daughters are married and live separately with their own families. Her older son works in Russia and her youngest son lives at home and helps her with housework.  

Bumalike works as a cook at a school.  She is also engaged in livestock breeding. Reselling livestock after fattening them, she contributes an additional 3000 soms to the family budget. With the money received from this loan, Bumalike wants to purchase two sheep in order to increase her number of livestock. In the near future, Bumalike wants to give her youngest son a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep

loans.name: Glenny

texts.en:
Glenny is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Glenny has a shop that sells beverages, snacks and canned goods. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Glenny has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Glenny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Hayotjon

texts.ru:
Хаётчон целеустремленный, ответственный и добрый человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Хаётчон занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Когда он ездит за товарами помогает ему его жена по бизнесу. Раньше у него был бизнес маленьким, а сейчас развивался. Теперь он продает широкий ассортимент продуктов, такие как растительное масло, чай, макароны, конфеты, рис, мука соль и т.д. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, и прибыль, который он планирует получить, он хочет покупать автомашину для перевозки продуктов. Хаётчон запрашивает займ 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов с целью расширения бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит вас за вашу поддержку и поощрения. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Hayotjon is a purposeful, responsible and kind man. He is married and is a loving father of one child. Hayotjon buys and sells food. When he goes out to buy the food his wife helps him with the business. Before that he had a small business and now it has grown. Right now he sells a wide variety of groceries such as vegetable oil, tea, spaghetti, candy, rice, four, sold and etc. He wants to expand his business and plans to use the profit to buy a vehicle for transporting the produce. Hayotjon is asking for a loan in the amount of $3,000USD to buy a new assortment of food and groceries with the purpose of growing his business. He is thanking all of you in advance for your support and encouragement.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is married and has five children. Three of her children are studying and her eldest son is a daily wage laborer. Her husband is also a daily wage laborer. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her animal sales business. She has been doing this business for many years and has maintained a good clientele base. She buys animals from the animal market and sells to the butchers at a profit. With the loan, she will purchase goats in good numbers and increase her sales. She is very confident that her business will improve further after the loan investment.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy other kinds of drinks so that she can increase her earnings

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul is the leader of this group. She is 52 years old and is divorced.  She has raised a daughter and a son.  Both children are married and live separately with their own families. 

Baktygul used to work as a school teacher of mathematics and at the moment she is a librarian in the Central Library of Balykchi. She applied for this  loan because she needs additional funds to repair an apartment. In the future, she wishes to purchase a vehicle for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair an apartment

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s loading business. He will buy a new donkey cart with the loan, which will allow him to carry a bigger load, provide better quality services to his customers and make more profits. 

She is the mother of five children but none of them is able to attend school due to financial constraints. She is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well. She is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve the financial condition of his business after the loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself as a very responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is married and her husband is a driver by profession. She is the mother of a son who is 23 years old. He operates a donkey cart through which he offers loading and unloading services to his clients. Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and can’t bear heavy loads. Shameem is hopeful that by purchasing a new donkey cart, her son will be able to improve his business by providing better quality loading services to his customers. He has been operating his business for many years and Shameem is very hopeful about his business growth after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.ru:
Рисолатхон живет со своим мужем и четверо детей в Таджикистане. Её муж работает таксистом. Рисолатхон умная, добрая и целеустремленная женщина, и она всегда старается улучшить свое жилищное условие.  Она в сфере бизнеса работает уже более 10 лет. Она начала свой бизнес с куплей продажей продуктов питания, а с 2004 года она вместе с подругой начала заниматься купля продажей ювелирных изделий. Теперь она сама владельцем данного бизнеса и она старается расширить этот бизнес.  Она приобретает товар с других рынка города и ещё она имеет постоянных поставщиков, который ей сами предоставляют товар.  Рисолатхон хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки ювелирных изделий для более большого выбора ассортимента товаров.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Risolatkhon lives with her husband and four children in Tajikistan. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Risolatkhon is a smart, kind and purposeful woman and she always tries to improve her living conditions. She has been doing business for more than ten years. She started her own business with buying food and since 2004 she and her friend started buying and selling jewelry. Right now she is the owner of this business and is trying to expand it. She buys merchandise from other markets and also has regular suppliers who offer their merchandise to her. Risolatkhon wants to get a loan in the amount of $3,000USD to buy jewelry for a wider range of merchandise variety. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
