loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship.  That is Marilou’s favorite quote. She is 45 years old, married, and blessed with five school-aged children. At her age, Marilou shares that she has to be patient and work hard to prepare to give her children a college level of education.

Despite the problems she encountered, Marilou just considers them as challenges in her life. She doesn’t want to lose her hopes that someday she will overcome them and will succeed.

At present, Marilou has difficulties in sustaining her farm inputs because of price increase. She wanted to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to apply on her rice crop. Her goal is to expand her farm area. She also wishes to have productive crops.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Saliya's Group

texts.en:
Saliya is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and is married to a driver. Together with the husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both children are studying at school. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 8000 soms Saliya purchased a cow, and since that moment she has been breeding farm animals. Reselling livestock after fattening them, she earns about 10000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for the family to purchase a minibus for transporting passengers. 

With the money received from this loan, Saliya wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is 46 years old, married and doesn’t have any children. She is involved in a business selling clothes. Along with her business, she carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She purchases clothes from wholesale markets and sells to her neighboring clients for a profit. Her husband is a fruit vendor. He puts fresh seasonal fruits on his cart and visits different streets in the city to sell. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her clothes selling business. The loan amount will allow her to purchase clothes in bulk to offer more variety to her clients and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for many years and has good experience in her work. She is confident that an investment will help her make more profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Anwer.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Malik

texts.ru: Малик проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Малик у себя дома имеет мельницу. Он занимается производством муки. В этой области он более пяти лет. Кредит берет для закупа пшеницы.
texts.en: Malik lives in the Rudaki region. He is 49 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Malik has a mill at home and does flour production. He has been in this business for more than five years. He is taking out the loan to buy wheat.

loans.use: to buy wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is married with four children. She knows the importance of education very well and that’s why she has enrolled all of her children in school. She is a very active person and supports her family financially by selling clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesale markets and sells to her local area clients at a profit. She has been doing her business for the past 10 years and has good knowledge about clothes and quality. Her husband is also very skillful and makes shoes. He supplies shoes to different shoe factories and shoe-selling shops. Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow her to offer more variety of clothes to her clients and increase her profits.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 52 years old and married.  He has been engaged in a transportation business, particularly in motorcycle transport. From it, he was able to generate P4,000 a month.  He had been doing this kind of business for eight months and he really enjoys his daily routine.  Aside from the transportation business, he also has a backyard piggery which he has had for one year.

Bienvinido would like to widen his backyard piggery and buy a door for his vehicle, but he has insufficient funds.  He is requesting for additional capital in the amount of P5,000.  This amount would really help him in maintaining his business and serve his customers satisfactorily by transporting them to and from the market.  He hopes that he can increase his profit so that he can sustain the needs of his family and feed his raised piglets.

loans.use: buy a door for his vehicle and expand his piggery business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз жительница района Рудаки. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она занимается торговлей. В ларьке, под навесом она занимается торговлей продуктов питания и фруктов. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже два месяца. Она берет кредит для покупки овощей и фруктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a resident of the Rudaki region. She is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. She does sales in a covered food stall where she sells food and fruits. She has been in this business for two months now. She is taking out the loan to buy fruits and vegetables to increase the variety of her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Artak

texts.ru:
Артаку 28 лет, он родился в деревне Срашен, Сьюникского региона. Артак получил среднее образование. Он живет с женой, 3-х летней дочерью, 84-х летней бабушкой пенсионеркой и братом, который учится в средней школе соседнего села Шикаох (Shikahogh). Жена  Артака работает в Шикаохской средней школе учительницей.
Артак занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Срашен уже 5 лет. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур и свиней, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Жена Артака помогает ему на ферме после окончания ее рабочего дня. Так как сельское хозяйство является основным источником дохода их семьи, они работают очень усердно, стараясь, чтоб их семья не нуждалась ни в чем. Выращенные овощи и фрукты, а также говядину, свинину, молоко и яйца Артак реализует в городе Капане. Также он арендует землю, на которой выращивает пшеницу, которую также продает. 
Сумма кредита в 600.000 драм необходима Артаку для проведения посевных работ, покупки 2 быков и 2 свиней.
texts.en:
Artak is twenty-eight.  He was born in the small village of Srashen in the Syuniksky region and has a high school education.  He lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter, his retired eighty-four-year-old grandmother and his brother, who is in high school in the neighboring village of Shikaokh.  Artak's wife is a high school teacher in Shikaokh. 

For five years Artak has made his living in agriculture in Srashen.  He raises big horned cattle, chickens, and pigs.  He also grows fruits and vegetables.  His wife helps him out on the farm when she gets home from work.  Since farming is the family's main source of income, they work very hard so the family doesn't need for anything.  Artak sells the ripe produce, beef, pork, milk, and eggs in the city of Kapan.  He also rents land where he grows wheat that he sells. 

Artak needs a loan of 600 drams for the growing season, and to buy two bulls and two pigs.

loans.use: to buy two bulls, two pigs and to use during the growing season.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 33 года. Замужем. Имеет четверых детей. Ее муж предоставляет услугу, такси. Сама она тоже предоставляет услугу. Мукаддас занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mukaddas lives in the town of Vahdat. 33 years of age. Married, with four children. Her husband provides taxi services. Mukaddas is also in the service business. She sews traditional national clothing. She has been doing this work for two years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kobil

texts.ru:
Кобил умный и образованный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 1 ребенка. С детства он мечтал иметь свой собственный бизнес и стать богатым человеком. Четыре года назад он открыл свой собственный бизнес и успешно продолжает. С начало он занимался услугой таксиста, а затем постепенно он открыл свою автомойку.  Теперь он хочет отремонтировать здание там, где он занимается мойкой автомобилей. С этой целью Кобил запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и доброты.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Kobil is a smart and educated person.  He is married and is a responsible father of one child.  Since childhood, he dreamed of having his own business and becoming a rich man.  He opened his business four years ago and successfully runs it now.  He started his business with proving a taxi service and then opened his own car wash.  Now, he wants to repair the building, where he washes cars.  To achieve this goal, Kobil is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  He is grateful in advance to all creditors for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car wash building

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda says that we make our fortune and we call them fate. Her thinking drove her to strengthen her dreams. 

Yolanda is 51 years of age, married, and has three children. She has been running a rice farming business for almost 30 years.  Yolanda dreams of having all her children finish their study and get good jobs someday. At her age, she constantly work hard on her farm to lessen her expenses for labor cost.   She is doing all of this just to give her family enough food and to send her children to school.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer to apply on her farm. She and her husband give their best in managing their farm to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a very supportive and active lady. She doesn’t have any skills but she performs her duties as a housewife very efficiently and is always ready to support her husband in the time of need. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating problems. Kosar is hopeful that after repairing his rickshaw, her husband will be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is also a rickshaw driver while her eldest daughter does sewing for her neighboring clients. They both do work to financially contribute to the family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling onions and cooking oil in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Christine requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Juliet has a business selling paper products, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase paper for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.        

Juliet is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: buy paper products

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 37 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Kassim has a business selling timber, which he has had for 4 years.         

To help expand his business, Kassim has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kassim hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business.  

Kassim is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: buy timber

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 47 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  

Milly has a poultry feeds business, which she has had for 10 years.  To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase poultry feeds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Milly hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.    

Milly is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds for resale

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is 37 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  

Lukia has a poultry business, which she has had for 2 years. To help expand her business, Lukia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lukia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.     

Lukia is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy five crates of onions and ten crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of his children are currently in school. Godfrey has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for 5 years.         

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Godfrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godfrey hopes to expand his business. Godfrey is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children. All of her children are currently in school. Jessica has a business of paper products, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase paper for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her business.  Jessica is a member of BRAC's small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase paper for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya and has been in mixed farming for four years with his produce of milk, cabbages and tomatoes being sold to the local market. He runs a grocery within the local market to supplement his farming income. He is 21 and single.

Joseph has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. He says improved farming income will help him pay for his college education as well as make his farming business more reliable in meeting his daily needs. He is optimistic he will be a major supplier of goat's milk since many people have not ventured into the business.

He says, however, that lack of organized markets for the farm produce remains a challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. All of his children are currently in school. Emmanuel has a business of a small retail shop that sells soap, sugar, which he has had for 3 years.         

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Emmanuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Emmanuel hopes to expand his business.  Emmanuel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving his business

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. One of his children is currently in school. Charles has a business of a small retail shop that sells produce like maize flour, which he has had for 2 years.         

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize flour, rice for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Charles hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Charles hopes to expand his business. Charles is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years of age and has been selling different kinds of groceries for three months. She is happy because through her retail shop business she is able to earn PHP1,500 monthly. She uses her income to pay for daily needs and savings for emergency purposes. She is thankful because she has been blessed with four children. According to her, she spends her income on her youngest child, a college student taking up criminology.

Virginia would like to buy her grocery inventory such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her general store business but she doesn't have enough funds. For this reason, she is asking for an additional capital amount of PHP7,000. She is hoping that she can avail her requested loan amount in order to be able to buy greater volumes of varied groceries, at discount costs, so she can offer better prices to customers. This will help her gain a better profit within her sector. Virginia gives thanks each day for being alive and having a business that allows her to cover her household expenses. She also hopes that she can support her student until he can finished his course.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, assorted biscuit, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her general store business.

loans.name: Elima

texts.en:
Elima has been operating a restaurant for the last three years in Kikuyu town. She is 40 years old and married to Benjamin. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to purchase of 120 kgs of meat and bones for sale.

In the future, Elima hopes to diversify into other businesses, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy meat and bones

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. Patrick has a small retail shop that sells electrical items. He has had this business for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase electrical items for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself. In the future, Patrick hopes to build a house of his own. Patrick is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase electrical items for resale.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru:
Отабек честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий 2 детей. Он занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Он начал свой бизнес с продажей маскаронов и сахара. Постепенно его бизнес развивался, и он добавил много других ассортимента продуктов. Отабек хочет получит максимальный прибыль для содержании своей семьи и обучение своих детей. Он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки продуктов питания.  Отабек заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их доброты и милосердие.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Otabek is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is married and a loving father of two children.  He is involved in buying and selling food products.  He started his business with sales of pasta and sugar.  His business gradually grew, and he added many other assortments of products.  Otabek wants to maximize his profits in order to support his family and educate his children.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of food products.  Otabek is grateful in advance to all creditors for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Sadati

texts.en:
Sadati is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Gulu region of Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Sadati has a business of a salon, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Sadati has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sadati hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Sadati hopes to expand her business. Sadati is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident and a farmer in Kitale Western Kenya. He is married with four children aged between 19 and 4 years old and all are schooling. He has been in farming for the last 15 years with his produce of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and milk going to the local market.

Moses has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo and he says it will make life much better for his family and help him improve his retail shop in the local market.

He notes that diseases are the worst challenge to farmers, especially the dairy ones since a lot of cost is incurred in managing the diseases. He is glad he joined Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Christine has a business selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Christine hopes to expand her business. Christine is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 45 years old and single with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a business selling tea in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Sabina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to buy a plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a kettle, glasses, and a chair to make tea to sell

loans.name: Mehrigul

texts.ru: Мехригул проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет высшее образование. Мехригул более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется продуктовый магазин. Она берет кредит для покупки сахара, вафель, сухофруктов, риса, гороха и макарон.
texts.en: Mehrigul lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 37 years old, married and has four children.  She has a higher education.  Mehrigul has been involved in retail sales for over ten years.  She has a food store.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, waffles, dried fruits, rice, peas and pasta.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, waffles, dried fruits, rice, peas and pasta

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 37 years of age and a housewife as well as a working lady. She operates an embroidery business for her neighboring clients. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes and earns income for her family. She does this business from her home and also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband is an employee in a government organization on meager income. 

Shahnaz has given birth to three children: two of them are getting their education while her youngest daughter stays at home and learns the art of embroidery from her mother. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material in bulk quantity which will allow her to make better quality embroidered dresses and increase her profits. She started her business seven years ago and it is working well for her. She hopes that it will be improved further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for embroidery business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 58 years old and lives in Goin, Liloy. She is married with five children. 

Amelita has a sari-sari store business and a snack vending business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for additional capital.

Amelita has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire, age 20, lives in the village of Capirpiriwan Cordon with her family. She spends her income on her only child who is still an infant. Claire is a hard-working woman who does not tire from struggling every day for her family’s well-being.

Claire raises and sells pigs within her village. She has been doing it for two years. According to her, hog raising is one of the main sources of income of the family. She always sees the need in her backyard piggery to make her pigs comfortable in their pens. In this matter, she is requesting a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed for raising piglets. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for raising piglets.

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.ru:
Худойберди добрый, умный и честный человек. Он любящий и ответственный муж. Худойберди вот уже более 5 лет занимается выпечкой национальных лепешек. В течение 2 года расширил свой бизнес в два раза и дальше настроен усовершенствовав навыки и умения, обогатить свой ассортиментам разными видами национальных лепешек. По мимо этого он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Худойберди хотел бы получит займ в размере 1300$ США для покупки муки и скота. Он заранее благодарен вам всем за вашу доброту!

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Khudoiberdi is a kind, smart and honest man. He is a loving father and a responsible husband. Khudoiberdi has been baking traditional flat breads for more than five years. During the two years he expanded his business by twice and plans to further develop his skills and abilities and to enrich his assortment production with different kinds of flat breads. He also does feeding and breeding of cattle. Khudoiberdi wants to receive a loan in the amount of $1,300USD to buy flour and cattle. He is thanking you all in advance for your kindness!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy flour and cattle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to more bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and also pay for labor.

loans.name: Khursona

texts.ru: Хурсона проживает в города Вахдат. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж предоставляет услугу, он парикмахер. Сама Хурсона занимается торговлей на рынке. Она занимается продажей детской обуви. В этой области она уже 17 лет. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Khursona lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 52 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband provides a service; he is a barber.  Khursona is involved in retail sales at a market.  She sells children's shoes and has been in this business for 17 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina is a 42-year-old widow who is living with her relative. Marselina does not have any children and her husband passed away in an accident one year ago. She originated from Sabu Island but decided to leave the island in order to seek better business opportunity so she can support her parent and sibling. 

Marselina runs a business of selling various vegetables (i.e. cucumbers, mustard greens, water spinach, eggplant, and spinach). She usually runs her business in a local traditional market. This business helps her generate income to cover their living expenses. Marselina spends the days in the market from 6am until 7pm operating her business. 

She dreams to enlarge her business by adding more vegetables. She participated in TLM’s group lending program and has a good repayment record and would like to apply for a bigger loan from TLM through the individual lending program. She is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000,000 IDR. She wants to buy various vegetables such as broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, string beans, etc. She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in making her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase various vegetables such as broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, cucumber, string beans, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 46, married and has four school-age children. They live happily in a village planting and harvesting rice for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she chose to engage in a hog raising business to earn additional income to continue sending their children to school and satisfy their daily basic needs. 

To improve her business, she is requesting additional capital of 30,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for hog raising. She mentioned that she needs to work hard and continuously strive to make her business grow. 

In the future, she wants to start another business and renovate their house to live more comfortably. She hopes that she will be able to reach her goal through hard work and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for hog raising

location.town: Brgy. San Fernando, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kandai

texts.en:
Kandai is 38 years old and married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client. He has been loaned KES 70,000. This is his second loan, which he has planned to use to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. 

He intends to use the return from the loan to put back into farming and to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Mwamina

texts.en:
Mwamina is a married woman with four children, all of whom all adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a dried fish selling business which contributes to her source of income. She dreams of establishing a selling shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a greengrocery business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a fully stocked greengrocery shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of onions, bananas, ground nuts and oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, bananas, ground nuts and oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs such as fertilzer and seeds.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children. One child attends school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a fruit parlor in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase a freezer to store fruit juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to store fruit juices for sale

loans.name: Sadbargul

texts.ru: Садбаргул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем. Имеет 4 детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Садбаргул занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает ткани. В этой области она более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Sadbargul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 41 years old, married and has four children.  Her children attend a secondary school.  Sadbargul is involved in retail sales at a market.  She has a store, where she sells fabrics.  She has been in this business for over ten years.  Sadbargul is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a single lady who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transport. 

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetics business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, Mwanaisha wants to purchase facial oil creams and beauty soap for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase facial oil creams and beauty soap for resale.

loans.name: Lunh

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Mrs. Lunh is a 26-year-old married mother of one school-aged child. A hardworking woman, Lunh now generates income by selling fish in a nearby market, earning about $4 USD per day. To augment her revenue, her husband works as a local construction worker, earning approximately $3 per day.

In order to increase her income, Lunh is requesting a loan through Kiva partner HKL to purchase more fish. In the future she will send her child to receive higher education, as do other families in the commune.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman who lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past six years, she has operated a vegetable sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her business. Halima dreams of establishing a larger shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes and potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

For the past ten years, she has operated a firewood sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Ширингул проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее 4 детей. Ее муж занимается торговлей. Сама Ширингул имеет магазин, где продает ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Shiringul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in sales.  Shiringul has a store, where she sells fabrics.  She has been involved in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Aida Ester

texts.en:
Aida Ester, a 53-year-old married mother of nine, lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte, where she has been operating a bus for the past five years. Each month, she earns approximately 3800 PHP.

A member of PMPC for two years, Aida Ester has requested a loan for 14900 PHP to pay the yearly renewal of her transportation documents. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay the yearly renewal of her bus transportation documents.

loans.name: Chhoeut

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeut, age 41, is a humble woman who presently lives in Siem Reap Province. She is married with four single children, two of them are employed in different jobs and the other two are students.

To earn a daily profit, Mrs. Chhoeut rents a few rooms to provide a karaoke service to people who need to sing a song with their family and friends. From this business, she gets a net income, on average, of 5 USD a day. She also has other income from her husband’s work as a fisherman. Mrs. Chhoeut would like to borrow a loan fund from Kiva through HKL in order to change rooms which are bigger than present time and she will use some of loan amount to buy some goods to sell for additional profits.

In the future plan, Mrs. Chhoeut hopes to use her income to expand her current business, to extend her house, and to send her children to study at university.

loans.use: to change rooms for running a karaoke service and to buy some goods to sell for additional profits

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 55 years old and a mother of four children: three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is married and operates a grocery store in the market where he sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, lentils, spices etc. His behavior with his customers is very good and his prices are also very reasonable; that’s why he has a good number of customers who purchase groceries from him regularly. Her other children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Khalida stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her son wants to expand his grocery store business. With the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk quantity which will allow him to fill the needs of his clients and earn more profits. He has been operating his business for the past three years and Khalida is hopeful that the loan will help him expanding his business and increase his profits. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity.

For the past the ten years, she has operated a coconut sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and starting a fish sales business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, Bintiali wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is fuel.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothing boutique, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, Elizabeth wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 28, lives in the town of Iganga, Uganda. He is married and has no children. For three years, Simon has had a small retail shop.

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase essential commodities, like sugar and soap, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, Simon hopes to expand his business. He is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, like sugar and soap, for resale.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin, 30, lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For three years, Yasin has had a small retail shop business.

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase essential commodities, like sugar and soap, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Yasin hopes to expand his business. He is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Galamhuseyn

texts.ru: Galamhuseyn 50 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Galamhuseyn uje 12 let kak rabotayet stroitelem. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya uludsheniya svoyey raboti. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek.
texts.en: Galamhuseyn is 50 years old.  He is married and has four children.  He lives in the Baku region together with his family.  Galamhuseyn has been working as a construction worker for 12 years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy necessary tools for improving his work.  He is a very hard-working person.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction tools

loans.name: Sampeke

texts.en:
Sampeke has been practicing farming in Narok, Kenya for the last 6 years. He is 37 years old, married and supports 6 people in the family.

He has been a good client and he repaid his previous loan well. He applied for his second loan and plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. 

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from seasonality in her business. She dreams of operating a shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs, Zainab wants to purchase cloth for her sewing business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her sewing business.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама она занимается торговлей канцелярских товаров. Год как она занимается этим видом бизнеса. Кредит берет для покупки общих тетрадей, школьных рюкзаков и книг.
texts.en: Nigora lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 23 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation.  Nigora is involved in sales of office supplies.  She has been in this business for one year.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of general-purpose notebooks, school backpacks and books.

loans.use: to purchase general-purpose notebooks, school backpacks and books for first-grade students

loans.name: Keav

texts.en:
Mrs. Keav is a 47-year-old widow living in Ornlong Veng District of Siem Riep Province, Cambodia. She is a hard-working woman. Now, she has two single children. Presently, Keav generates her income by farming. From this business, she earns a low income per day. To assist her revenue, both of her children work as local construction workers and they earn suitable monthly salaries. 

Everyday, they must spend some of their money on a motor taxi to get to work. Due to expense like this, Keav and her children would to have a motorbike. Due to the lack of cash, Keav wishes to request a loan through HKL partner with Kiva to purchase a motorbike for riding to work everyday.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is married and her husband has a business selling groceries. He runs a grocery shop where he sells daily-use items such as spices, sugar etc. He is very fair in his rates and offers his customers good variety to choose their required products. 

Bashiraan is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons also operate grocery businesses while her daughter is studying in class 10. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to be able to put in his shop for fulfilling the orders on time and increasing his profits. 

Bashiraan is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and her family will be able to live better as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 38, lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is divorced and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Esther has a restaurant business, which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food to sell in her restaurant. With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Esther hopes to expand her business. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start another business, with the purchase of a photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a cage for breeding her hogs and to buy additional feeds for fattening her hogs

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahambu, leader du groupe d’affaire «Nyota », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 38  ans, mère de 3 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école secondaire. Elle est  vendeuse de d’habit (pagnes). Son mari est ingénieur  électro -mécanicien. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central. Il y a 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle a reçu son premier capital de sa grande sœur sous forme de d’assistance. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  25 pièces de wax hollandais à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The customer Kahambu is the leader of the Nyota business group and is a 38-year old entrepreneur who is mother to three young children who are still at secondary school. She sells "pagnes" (colourful West African fabric). Her husband is an engineer and electro-mechanic. She displays her goods at the central market and has been carrying out small income-generating businesses of this kind for the past seven years. Meanwhile, she received her initial capital from her elder sister. This new loan will be used to purchase 25 pieces of "wax hollandais" fabric. She would also like to see her children grow up in comfort and expand her business; The customer thanks Hekima for it actions in favour of poor women who cannot access classic banks.

loans.use: payer 25 pièces de wax hollandais to pay for 25 pieces of "wax hollandais" fabric

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 48 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children; one child is currently in school. Margret has a small retail shop, which she has had for two years. She owns rental houses as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Margret hopes to expand her business.  

Margret is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 4 children. Angelina has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for sale

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Paz has a tailoring shop that makes and sells office and school uniforms.  She also repairs dresses & curtains. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for tailoring.
Paz is a member of HSPFI. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for tailoring

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; all of his children are currently in school. Saidi has a business of leather products, like suitcases and bags, which he has had for six years.         
	
To help expand his business, Saidi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase leather products like suitcases and bags for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Saidi hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Saidi hopes to construct rental houses to get more money to support his family. 

Saidi is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase leather products like suitcases and bags for resale.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она уже три года как занимается торговлей.  В основном она у себя дома продает сухофрукты. Кредит берет для приобретения сухофруктов.
texts.en: Salomat lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 56 years old, married and has five children.  She has been involved in retail sales for three years.  She primarily sells dried fruits at home.  Salomat is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 42 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; both of her children are currently in school. Rachael has a business of selling poultry and animal feeds, which she has had for over 10 years. She also has a tailoring business.  

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase poultry and animal feeds for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living.  In the future, Rachael hopes to expand her business.    

Rachael is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and animal feeds for resale.

loans.name: Myna

texts.en:
Myna is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. 
Myna makes & sells snacks like rice cakes, suman & ice candies. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Myna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 27 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  For the past year, Margret has operated a business selling phones and phone accessories. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business and business skills.

Margret is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to help expand her business by purchasing phones and accessories for resale. With the help of her loan she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Margret hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Ngaza

texts.en:
Ngaza is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, she has operated a firewood-selling business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. Ngaza decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Ngaza is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of firewood to sell and establish a business stall. She dreams of becoming a leading firewood supplier in the future.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and to establish a business stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ntiati

texts.en:
Ntiati has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 36 years old and married. His wife is a house wife and they are blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his third loan. He has planned to spend the money to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the profit from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and most well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Gena has a shop that sells school & office supplies. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of office & school supplies to sell.
Gena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of office & school supplies to sell

loans.name: Carinsan

texts.en:
Carinsan is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. 
Carinsan has a tailoring shop that makes & repairs office & school uniforms. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Carinsan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carinsan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds,  fertilizers and also pay for labor.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya and has been in active farming for over 30 years producing and selling coffee, groundnuts and bananas which he sells to the local market. He is age 70 and married with 4 adult children. He currently employs one farmhand in his farm.

Joseph has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter. He says this will make it easier for him to feed his dairy cows and improve on his milk production. He is very optimistic with his farming business saying access to a loan is a great solution to their farming problems.

He reiterates finances are the greatest limitation to farmers. He says he will strengthen the his partnership with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Frelly

texts.en:
Frelly is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Frelly has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Frelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Frelly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two girls, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, Mariam has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mariam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mariam is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she dreams of becoming a leading supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children. One of her children attends school and the other four have graduated. Mwanajuma owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 13 years, she has operated a beauty salon business and her customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition, Mwanajuma also operates a motorcycle transport business that provides another source of income. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanajuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
 
Mwanajuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. In the future, she dreams of establishing a spare parts shop.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and  two goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Ailen has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Ailen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nazia Bibi

texts.en:
Nazia bibi is 26 years old, married with three children: two sons and a daughter. Her son is five years old and is in kindergarten. The others are too young to attend school. Her husband is involved in agriculture. He grows different seasonal crops and earns good from his business. 

Nazia herself is a supportive lady and helps her husband by operating a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffaloes and sells to her local area clients to earn income. She has been doing this business for the past six years and has a good clientele base due to her good quality milk. 

Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her milk selling business. With the loan she will buy another buffalo that will increase the milk productivity and sales as well. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business in result.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rafikhon

texts.ru: Рафихон проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 20 лет. Он не женат. Имеет среднее образование. Три года как занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке города, где продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Rafikhon lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 20 years and single.  He has a secondary education.  He has been involved in sales for three years.  Rafikhon leases a retail outlet at the city's central market, where he sells fruits.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Elsa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Elsa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 44 years old and has been in the farming business for twenty years.  He currently produces milk which he sells to the local market.  He is married with one child who is in school.  

Justin has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into the transportation business.  This is his second loan with Juhudi.  He says Juhudi's first loan helped him, and he remains optimistic that the transportation business will also be a success like his dairy business.

Justin notes that drought is the challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past three years, she has operated a nursery school; children from the neighboring community attend the school. She faces a major challenge of competition from other neighboring schools. She dreams of expanding her school to accommodate higher classes in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stationery, books, pens, tables and chairs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stationery, books, pens, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry is a farmer working in Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She grows rice and has been in this business for many years. She is married to Chen who also works. They have given birth to two kids who they support with their profit. Both of her children are attending school. 

From this business, Sry earns approximately $2 USD per day.  Sry would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials but lacks the capital.  So, she wishes to have help from Kiva. She will use these funds to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials to help her earn a living.  

Sry hopes that these funds will help her make more profit, and she is very grateful for all the lenders that help her family. She says that everything she does is for her family’s well-being because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with one boy who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 11 years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other food vendors in the area. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to establish a food stall business, purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a food stall business, purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Khursheed Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed bibi is 26 years old, married and has a son who is six years old and is reading in class one. Khursheed herself is a caring mother and wife,  who takes care of her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is involved in groceries selling business. He runs a grocery shop at his home. He has occupied a room of his house for this purpose. He sells daily household items like sugar, spices, lentils, etc from his shop to his customers and generates income for the family. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to be able to put to his  shop for selling. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be established further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed bibi.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Srel

texts.en:
Srel is a farmer working in Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She grows rice and has been in this business for many years. She is married to Khlee and has six children who are living under her revenue. All of her children are enrolled in school. 

From this business, Srel earns about $2 each day. To improve her family's living conditions, Srel would like to construct a new house, but she lacks the equity.  So, she wishes to request some funds through HKL, partnered with Kiva. She hopes that these funds will make her family full of happiness and prosperity all the time. She is very grateful to all the lenders that sponsor her.  In the future, she will send all her children to study at a high level, like other families.

loans.use: to construct a house.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is aged 23 and married with two children aged 8 and 1. The first one is already in school. She has been in farming for two years producing horticultural products and coffee.

Emmaculate has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase poultry birds and venture into poultry farming. She says the income will supplement her dairy business and help improve the living standard of her family. She is focusing on attending training to gain more knowledge in farming.

She says that a farmer's challenge remains the lack of knowledge in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for laborers to prepare the land and to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Fish is known as a vital fresh food for everyone.  In particular, the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Ly is among the people who currently depend on selling fish at the local market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. 

Ly is a humble mother who has been blessed with a lovely young child. From this business, Ly makes approximately $3 per day. To upgrade their living, Ly and her husband would like to purchase fishing materials but lack the cash.  Ly has decided with her husband to request funds through HKL who partners with Kiva. She expects that these funds will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to the kind lenders that will help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Saidbi

texts.ru: Саидби проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 54 года. Замужем. Имеет 6 детей. Образование у нее среднее. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки костюмчиков для новорожденных.
texts.en: Saidbi lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 54 years old, married and has six children.  She has a secondary education.  Saidbi is involved in sales of children's clothing and has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of suits for newborns.

loans.use: to purchase suits for newborns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

loans.name: Sarain

texts.en:
Sarain, 43 year old, is a policeman earning $3 per day. His wife stays home. He has three children, 19, 17, and 14 years old. One of them is studying and the other two are working for $3.3 per day each. 

Every month, he has to spend $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. He wants to buy this plot of land because when he retires from his current work, he wants to do farming to earn some money for his family. He hopes to send his last child to study in the university when he finishes high school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for doing farming.

loans.name: Adjouavi Nina

texts.fr:
