Nina est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Lesquels enfants sont tous scolarisés. Son époux travaille dans une entreprise de la place. Ensemble, le couple arrive à faire face aux charges du ménage. 
Nina est une commerçante. Elle commercialise des poissons et viandes congelés depuis 11 ans. Son fonds de commerce est installé à son domicile. Elle emploie une jeune fille qui l'aide dans ses activités. Ses produits sont vendus aux restauratrices et aux ménages de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle fait ses approvisionnements au fur et à mesure de l'écoulement de ses produits, dans une société de vente des produits congelés de la place. 
Nina a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour pouvoir combler les attentes de sa clientèle. Le revenu supplémentaire produit par ce crédit permettra de d'accroître sa participation financière au foyer et de contribuer ainsi à l’épanouissement de ses progénitures et de ses proches.
texts.en:
Nina is married and the mother of three children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband works in a local enterprise. Together the couple are managing to cover their household expenses. 

Nina is a businesswoman. She has been selling frozen fish and meat for 11 years. Her sales are made out of her home. She employs a young woman who helps her in her business. Her products are sold to owners of restaurants and to housewives in her area and around her home. She buys her goods from a local business selling frozen foods, little by little as she sells her stock. 

Nina requested and has been granted a small loan from FINADEV in order to stock up on a sufficient quantity of goods to be able to satisfy the demand of her clientele. The supplementary revenue produced by this loan will permit her to make a greater financial contribution to her household and thus contribute to the well-being of her children and those near and dear to her.

loans.use: to buy 20 cartons of frozen fish.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 30 years old, sells food. Her husband is a construction worker, and their income is $15 per day. She has three children, 10, 6 and 3 years old. Two are studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $8 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy more grocery goods to sell so that she can make more income. In the future, she wants to extend her food store to sell more food, and with the income she gets from her business she wants to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Har

texts.en:
Har, 58 years old, is a recycler. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $15 per day. 

She has four children, 29, 27, 21 and 20 years old. None of her children is studying; they are all working in the factory for $13 per day for all. 

Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on hire workers, $35 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a hand tractor for plowing the villagers' farms to get some more income when her husband is off from doing construction. In the future, she wants to extend her recycle warehouse to stock more things for resale.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for plowing.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been operating a car wash for the past three years. He is 35 years old and married with two children. He has applied for his first loan of KES.40,000. He plans to employ two casual workers to work in the car wash and expand his business.

With the anticipated profit he plans to re-invest in the business. 

He dreams of becoming a leading business man.

loans.use: to employ two casual workers to work in the car wash and expand his business

loans.name: Houen

texts.en:
Houen, 56 years old, is a farmer with $8 per day for her income. She is a single mother who lives with three children, and all of them are working for $3.5 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $155 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy fruit from local farmers for resale. She just started this career, and if she gets a good profit, she will continue doing it. She hopes to support her children so that they can learn a skill that can get them a good career for their living in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruit from local farmers for resale.

loans.name: Pall

texts.en: Pall is a hard-working 59-year-old woman. She is married and has nine children. Six of her children have already married and live independently. One of her daughters is working as a sewing factory worker and another son is working as a local construction worker in Phnom Penh city where they earn a suitable salary each month. The rest of her children are enrolled in school. To earn a living in a good situation like other families, Pall has decided with her husband to purchase farmland for doing a farming business. However, she lacks capital so she would like to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva. She hopes that this fund will make her family meet happiness and gain more profits. She is very thankful to all the kind lenders who always help her family. This loan with be very useful and it will allow Pall to continue with the good development of her farming business and to improve her family's quality of life

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong, 36 years old, is a construction worker with her husband. Their income is $11 per day. She has one child, and he is 13 years old and studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $77 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in front of her house. She used to sell fish around the village, but now she has changed businesses. In the future, she wants to repair her house to be better than now and try hard to send her son to study in the university.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru: Elnur 20 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elnur jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On uje 2 qoda kak virashivayet pomidori. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenku i balki dlya togo chtobi sdelat parnik dlya pomidora. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje imel svoy parnik.
texts.en: Elnur is 20 years old.  He is single and does not have children.  Elnur lives in the Baku region together with his family.  He has been growing tomatoes for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy plastic and beams in order to build a greenhouse for tomatoes.  He learned this business from his father, who also had his own greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams in order to build a greenhouse for tomatoes

loans.name: Lab

texts.en: Lab, 49 years old, is selling gruel fish. Her husband is a motorbike repairer; their income is $15 per day. She has four children; three are studying and one more is working as a construction worker with $5 income per day. Every month, she has to spend $165 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy motorbike stuff for her husband's career. If her husband's career can move on well, she wants to get a shop for selling bicycles at home. For her children, she wants to support thE. to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy motorbike stuff for her husband's career.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 44 years old and is a farmer. Her husband is a fisherman who also works as a farmhand when he cannot find fish to sell. Their combined income is 6 USD daily. Sokha has four children, three of whom are studying and one who is working in Korea and earning 30 USD each day. Sokha’s monthly expenses include 50 USD for food, 10 USD for electricity, 10 USD for rent, 20 USD for school fees, and 20 USD for other expenses.

Sokha is requesting a 500 USD loan to buy a hand tractor to help her farm and transport her product to the market to sell. In the future, she wants to raise and sell ducks. Sokha also wants to provide all of her children with an education through high school.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor

loans.name: Yein

texts.en:
Yein is 55 years old and has a business selling food. Her husband works for the government as a village consultant. Their combined income is 5 USD per day. Yein has two children, who are 19 and 20 years old. They both work in a factory and each earns 3 USD daily. Each month, Yein spends 50 USD on food, 8 USD on electricity, 3 USD on rent, and 10 USD on other expenses. 

Yein is requesting a 300 USD loan to buy piglets to raise and sell. Her loan will provide capital for starting this business and Yein hopes that she will continue to expand her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok is 63 years old and is a single mother who lives with her two children. She earns 8 USD daily from her business selling food. Together, her children earn 7 USD a day. Pok’s monthly expenses include 90 USD on food, 8 USD on electricity, 5 USD on transportation, and 10 USD on other expenses.

Pok is requesting a 300 USD loan to buy construction materials for her son’s business career. She hopes that he will be able to keep his business running well so that he will be able to better support the family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her son's business

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: As is known, the fish is the main vital fresh food for everyone, and in particular, the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Eam is among those people who currently depend on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Eam is a humble mother who has been blessed with two lovely young children who are attending school. From this business, Eam gains approximately $2 per day. To upgrade their living, Eam and her husband would like to purchase fishing materials but they lack money, so Eam has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva. She expects that this fund will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all the kind lenders who always help her family

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Isufbeg

texts.ru: Исуфбег проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии проработал два года. Сейчас он занимается животноводством. Исуфбег откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Isufbeg lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 35 years old, married and has four children.  He has a higher education, and is a teacher.  He spent two years working in that field.  Currently, he is involved in animal husbandry.  Isufbeg fattens up and sells livestock.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells water and distributes bottled water. She has been doing it for the past three years.

She learned about KADET through a registered customer. She has applied for her first loan of 40,000 KES. She plans to expand her business and have premises. She also wants to purchase more bottles and tanks for water. 

With the anticipated profit she wants to reinvest in the business and also repay the loan. She dreams of prospering in life.

loans.use: to expand her business, have premises, and purchase more bottles and tanks for water.

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru: Faig jivet Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Faig 48 let. On uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom i sojayet pomidori. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi pomenat sistemu orosheniya tak kak ona ochen staraya i ploxo oroshayet zemlyu.
texts.en: Faig lives in the Baku region together with his wife and children.  He is 48 years old, married and has two children.  Faig has been involved in agriculture and growing tomatoes for ten years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to replace his sprinkler system because it is very old and does not water the ground well.

loans.use: to replace a sprinkler system

loans.name: Agarezi

texts.ru: Agarezi 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Seychas on jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy i bolshoy semyoy. Agarezi seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN xchtobi kupit rassteniya i sajenci dlya pereprodaji. Uje 8 let kak on zanimayetsya prodajey rassteniy. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego druga.
texts.en: Agarezi is 40 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Currently, he lives in the Baku region together with his beloved and large family.  Agarezi needs 2000 AZN in order to buy plants and seedlings for resale.  He has been involved in selling plants for 8 years.  He learned this business from his friend.

loans.use: to buy plants and seedlings for resale

loans.name: Purevdulam

texts.en:
Purevdulam is 42 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He and his wife run a sewing workshop and fill orders to make clothes. Purevdulam has been running his business since 1998. Last year, he moved to a new workshop. His daughter, Elbegsaikhan, helps her parents with their business and this year she is going to enter college. Purevdulam has successfully repaid a previous loan that he used to purchase his original equipment when he was just starting his sewing business. 

Purevdulam is requesting a loan to renovate his workshop, including updating his sewing machine and equipment, which has become very old and unreliable. This is negatively affecting his business and output. Purevdulam will also buy quantities of coat materials on the open market.

loans.use: to renovate his workshop and update his sewing maching and equipment

loans.name: Mahmadshokir

texts.ru: Махмадшокир проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается растениеводством. В основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mahmadshokir lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 34 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in agriculture and primarily grows vegetables for sale.  Mahmadshokir has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabine Wendpouiré

texts.fr:
Mme Sabine Wendpouiré est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous les 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle est restauratrice depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au yaar de nagrin en ville à Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 marmite, un foyer à gaz et 04 grandes casseroles.

Mme économise pour ouvrir d’autres restaurants annexes. Elle ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants à travers la scolarisation et construire une maison d’habitation pour soi-même.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabine Wendpouiré is married with four dependent children. The oldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 6. All four children go to school. 

She has been working in the restaurant business for three years. She gets her supplies at the market of Nagrin, in the city of Ouagadougou. Her customers are women, men and children.

She wants to buy one stockpot, a gas fireplace, and four large pots.

Mrs. Sabine is saving her money to open other restaurants. She intends to provide for her children’s education and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy one stockpot, a gas fireplace and four large pots

loans.name: Absatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Absatou   est une jeune célibataire de 33 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est serveuse dans un restaurant de la place, mais en même temps elle exerce l’activité de commerce . Ainsi elle s’adonne depuis 3 ans déjà a  la vente de chaussures, parfums, colliers, boubous  traditionnels, poudriers et maquillage. Elle a choisi cette activité par nécessité   afin qu’elle puisse prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et arrondir les fins de mois. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2007. Elle a déjà remboursé deux prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 prévu pour l’achat  de marchandises qu’elle va aller vendre en Gambie. A son retour elle prévoit d’acheter d’autres  produits qu’elle va pouvoir vendre au Sénégal. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement et de mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Ms. Absatou is a single 33-year old woman living in Senegal. She is a waitress in a local restaurant, but at the same time she works as a vendor. Since three  years ago, she has been selling shoes, perfume, necklaces, traditional "boubou" outfits, cosmetic powder and make-up. She has chosen this activity out of necessity, in order to be able to take care of her expenses and make ends meet. She is a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since May 2007. She has already repaid two prior loans. She is seeking a credit of 250,000 in order to buy merchandise in Gambia. After returning, she will buy some additional goods that she will be able to resell in Senegal. This financing will allow her to bolster her working capital and better develop her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional outfits, shoes etc for resale

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary has been selling water for the past three years.  He is 28 years old and is married.  He has two children.   He is applying for his first loan of KES.50,000, with which he plans to increase the capital of the business by employing one casual worker to assist in the distribution and sale of water.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to re-invest the returns in the business.  His dream is to become a leading businessman in the area.

loans.use: to increase the capital for the business by employing one casual worker to assist in the distribution and sale of water.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with one boy who attends school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, Mwanamkuu has operated a restaurant and her customers are neighbors and community members. Her major business challenges are competition and seasonality. Mwanamkuu decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwanamkuuis requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking oil. In the future, she dreams of expanding her restaurant and establishing another one.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, one boy and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a water vending business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other water vendors in the market. Alice dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase jerrycans for water distribution. She decided to join Yehu because of the variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase jerrycans for water distribution.

loans.name: Chiziwi

texts.en:
Chiziwi is a married woman with five children, three boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing selling business, selling kikoi (colored cloth used as clothing) and bed sheets to her neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase 35 pieces of kikoi and 20 pieces of bed sheets. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 35 pieces of kikoi and 20 pieces of bed sheets.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children. Two attend school while two are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past nine years, she has operated a street food-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru: On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Elnur 24 qoda. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenki i balki dlya parnika. On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom, ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i xorosho spravlyayetsya s ney.
texts.en: Elnur is married and has one child.  He is 24 years old.  He lives in the Baku region together with his wife and child.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN i order to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse.  He has been involved in agriculture for five years, loves his work and does well at it.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse

loans.name: Wagne

texts.fr: Madame Wagne est mariée et âgée de 44 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le secteur du commerce. Sa spécialité concerne la vente de produits vestimentaires. Elle capitalise une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Depuis sa tendre enfance  Wagne aidait sa maman et a fini par pratiquer la même activité de commerce.  Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000. Une partie du crédit est prévue pour  s’approvisionner en thioups et l’autre partie sera destiné a renforcer son activité d’aviculture, tout pour les besoins de son commerce en cette veille de ramadan et  korité.  Ce financement lui permettra d’élargir son activité et mais d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Ms. Wagne is married and 44 years old. She lives in Senegal and is active in commerce. Her specialty concerns the sale of clothing. She capitalizes on three years of experience in her business. When she was very young, she used to help her mom. Now she works in the same business. Wagne has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2011. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs. Part of the loan is for stocking up on thioups cloth (dyed fabrics), and the other part will be for bolstering her poultry business. All of this is for business purposes for Ramadan on the eve of the Korité holiday. This financing will enable her to expand her business but also to grow her profits.

loans.use: to buy "thioups" fabrics and hens to resell

loans.name: Arshavir

texts.ru:
Аршавир родился в 1974 г. в городе Капан. После окончания Капанской средней школы он поступил в Ереванский Государственный Университет. 
Жена Аршавира не работает и сидит дома с детьми: сыну 2 года, дочери - 4. Родители Аршавира живут вместе с ним и помогают ему на ферме.  
С 2004 года  Аршавир занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Гегануш, Сьюниксйого региона. Он с помощью родителей разводит крупный рогатый скот и кур. Также у него есть огород, на котором он выращивает овощи на продажу. Также Аршавир продает говядину, молоко и яйца своим постоянным клиентам в Капане и, таким образом, содержит свою семью.  
Данный кредит является вторым, получаемым Аршавиром от Нор Оризона, и на этот раз ему необходим кредит на сумму 450,000 для приобретения сена и лекарства для домашнего скота.
texts.en: Arshavir was born in 1974 in the city of Kapan.  After graduating from the Kapan secondary school, he attended the Yerevan State University.  Arshavir's wife does not work and stays home with the children. Their son is two years old, and the daughter is four.  Arshavir's parents live together with them and help him with the farm.  Arshavir has been involved in agriculture in the Geganush village in the Syunik region since 2004.  With the help of his parents, he breeds cattle and chickens.  He also has a land plot, where he grows vegetables for sale.  Arshavir also sells beef, milk and eggs to his loyal customers in Kapan and, thus, supports his family.  This is his second loan from Nor Horizon, and this time he needs a loan in the sum of 450,000 in order to buy hay and medicine for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy hay and medicine for his farm animals

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a hardworking 40-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with two children who are in school. 

For the last four years he has been offering tailoring services so as to make a living and meet the needs of his family. He makes an extra shilling by engaging in farming. He wants in the next five years to have opened up another tailoring shop and expanded his business to create employment for others. 

He is requesting for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and material for tailoring. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to maintain good customer relationships.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and material for tailoring.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a committed 37 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with 3 children between 5 and 12 years old.  For the last 3 years he has been running a butcher shop to make a living. He supplements his income with the earnings from poultry farming.  In the next 5 years he wants to have opened up another butcher shop and to be a major distributor of eggs in his county. 

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows to slaughter. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now learned business management skills.

loans.use: to buy cows to slaughter

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a hardworking 52 year-old. He is married and blessed with 5 children, two of whom are in school. For the last two years he has been selling stationery in order to meet the needs of his family. He makes an extra shilling by cultivating tea and engaging in dairy farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be the leading distributor of stationery in his region. 

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings pay for a trading license and to renovate the premises. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: to pay for the trading license and renovate the premises

loans.name: Sop Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Khadim Rassoul est créé le 14 décembre 2008, il regroupe 09 membres qui s'activent dans le petit commerce.

La présidente du groupe Fatou est une femme mariée de 44 ans, mère de 06 enfants et a à sa charge 05 autres enfants.Elle est à droite habillée en rose.

Elle tient une table devant sa maison et vend divers produits alimentaires. Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité.

Avec son crédit elle voudrait acheter des marchandises à revendre afin de se faire pus de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Khadim Rassoul was created on the 14th of December, 2008. It is made up of 9 people who are all small retailers.
The group's president, Fatou, is a 44-year-old married woman with 6 children of her own and 5 more in her care. She is on the right of the picture, dressed in pink. She sells various food products from a table set up in front of her home and has a lot of experience in this area.
She will use the loan to restock her merchandise and increase her revenue. She plans to use the profits to ameliorate her family´s living conditions and contribute to the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to restock her merchandise.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a determined, 22-year-old businessman. He is single. 

He has been managing a business of motorbike transportation to make a living. His dream is to have several motorbikes for transportation. In five years, he hopes to be using a bus for transportation.
 
He is requesting for a loan of 10,000 KES to be used for the maintenance of his motorbike. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya,he has been enabled to save and also to access credit.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Kariuki

texts.en:
Kariuki is a hardworking business man aged 54 years. He is married and blessed with 4 children. For the last 24 years he has been operating a hotel so as to make a living. Previously he was running a butchery. In the next 5 years, he wants to have transformed his hotel into a 3 star hotel. His dream is to own several businesses. 

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to make his business stable.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is 44  years old and married. She supports a family of eight people. She runs a retail shop. she has been in her bussiness for a period of three  years. She was given a loan of KES. 20,000 which she invested in her business. She earns a monthly income of  six thousand per month. She will use the loan to purchase other goods and also improved the animals she has. She will use the anticipated profit to buy a plot and also to educate her children. This is her first loan with KADET and she believes that she will pay it well. Her hope for the future is to extend the business and to educate her children to be better people in future.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing more goods for resale

loans.name: Aliheydar

texts.ru: Aliheydar rodilsya v 1987 qodu. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Aliheydar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec i korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov i ovec dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Aliheydar was born in 1987.  He is single and does not have children.  Aliheydar lives in the Baku region together with his parents.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years and breeds cattle and sheep.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and sheep for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has three children, two girls and one boy, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing for the family. 

For the past year, Florence has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She decided to expand her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase quantities of cooking fat oil, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cooking fat oil, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one daughter. He and his family live in Melitopol. Alexander runs a small business selling warm, colorful blankets, pillows and bed sheets. He has been in this trade for eight years and his business has proven to be competitive in this commercial sector. 

Alexander has an enterprising spirit. The success he has achieved is a direct result of his hard work and commitment to his business. Alexander would like to receive a loan of 15,000 Grivnas to increase his assortment of merchandise so that he can provide more items and better service to his customers.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a married woman who has two children, one boy and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past three years, she has been selling clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and high costs of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a tea leaves business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and to establish a tea leaves business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and to establish a tea leaves business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 56 years old with a business in quarry mining. He is married to Jane. They are blessed with four children. He has been in the business for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to employ labor for stone cutting to improve the stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his last born since the others are self-sustaining. His hope is to purchase another quarry ground, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To employ labor for stone cutting

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children, two boys and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a curio shop business, hawking along the street, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sculptures for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sculptures for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 25 years old and married to Claudia. He supports a family of five. He has been practicing farming for a period of one year. He earns a monthly income of KES 1,800. He has been loaned KES 10,000. This is his first loan with Kadet. He will be using the loan to purchase dairy cows. 

He will use the anticipated profit to improve the dairy farm. He hopes to have a good life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase threads and fabric. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabric.

loans.name: Ilseyar

texts.en:
Ilseyar is divorced. She raises two children: a 13-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. She sells office and school supplies as well as souvenirs and camera accessories in one of the local marketplaces in her hometown of Kahovka. Ilseyar has been in this business for 13 years. Presently, she has 18,000 Ukraine hryvnia (UAH) invested in inventory. Her net profit is about 6,000 UAH a month. 

Ilseyar is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to use as working capital to buy necessary inventory and increase her assortment of merchandise. Ilseyar has used micro loans before and found them very helpful for her business growth.

loans.use: to increase assortment of school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing materials to add to her shop.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Witness, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a business of selling new and second-hand clothes and shoes, which she sells door to door, for two and a half years now.  She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the stock for her business and also prepared and sold nutritious flour to make baby food (lishe). She has repaid all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more new and second-hand clothes and bags to sell. She will also increase the lishe stock.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a bricks selling business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mavuno," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more new and second-hand clothes and bags to sell and increase stock of lishe.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking fat, rice and sugar for his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late-20s, is married with two children and one of them goes to school.  She has had a charcoal business for two years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy four sacks of charcoal and pay for household expenses.  She paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a retail shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Parachichi," which has a total of 17 members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sop Seydina Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Seydina Mohamed est créé depuis le 14 décembre 2008, il regroupe 16 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

La présidente Diama est une femme de 47 ans, mariée, avec 02 enfants,02 nièces et sa mère malade en sa charge.

Elle tient une alimentation générale avec son frère. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en boubou bleu rouge avec un châle orange sur les épaules et a levé la main gauche.

Elle voudrait avec son crédit renforcer son commerce pour gagner plus.

Elle a en sa charge les soins médicaux de sa mère et de son mari malades et elle soutient ses enfants dans leurs formations et scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Sop Seydina Mohamed was created on December 14, 2008 and brings together 16 women who all come from the same neighborhood and whose principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

The president, Diama, is 47, married, and responsible for two children, two nieces and her ailing mother.  

She runs a grocery store together with her brother. She has good experience in this field. In the photo, she is on the right, dressed in a blue and red robe with an orange scarf over her shoulders and raising her left hand. 

She would like to use her loan to bolster her business so as to earn more. 

She is responsible for the medical treatment of her mother and her husband, who are both ill, and she pays for her children's training and school fees.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Sop Cheikh Ibra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Cheikh Ibra est créé le 14 décembre 2008, Il est composé de 10 femmes qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

La présidente Dieumb est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Sur la photo elle est à droite et vêtue de grand boubou rose et emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche.

Elle est commerçante. Elle vend des habits et des chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar ou dans la ville même. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité.

Avec Son crédit elle voudrait renforcer son commerce.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle participe aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Sop Cheikh Ibra was created on December 14, 2008. It is made up of 10 women whose principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

The president, Dieumb, is a woman of 62, married, and the mother of six children. In the photo she is ..... 

She is a merchant, selling clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. She buys her merchandise in Dakar or in her own town. She has a good deal of experience in her field. 

With her loan, she wants to bolster her business. With her profit, she shares in covering family needs.

loans.use: to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois; il est composé de vingt femmes qui sont issues de différents quartiers de la ville mais qui se réunissent chaque mois pour leurs activités de commerce.

La présidente du Banc Villageois Fatou âgée de 44 ans,est une femme mariée mère de neuf enfants dont deux jumelles, elle a en charge une fille de sa sœur et une autre de sa cousine.Elle mène un petit commerce de tissus,encens,parfums, pâte alimentaires....elle a une bonne expérience de  dix ans. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en vert fluo et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achéte ses produits au marché central de la ville et revend dans son quartier.
Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter une cuisinière pour faire de la pâtisserie puisqu'elle excelle également dans ce domaine.
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la scolarité et le petit déjeuner des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey was created on December 15, 2008 when the "Village Bank" was inaugurated. It is made up of 20 women who come from various neighborhoods of the town but who come together every month for their business activities. 

The president of the Village Bank, Fatou, 44, is a married woman and the mother of nine children with two sets of twins. She is also responsible for her sister's daughter and a cousin's daughter. She has a little business selling cloth, incense, perfume, pasta, etc. She has 10 years' experience. She is standing on the far right in the photo, dressed in fluorescent green and raising her hand.  

She buys her products at the central market of the town and sells them in her neighborhood. She wants to use her loan to buy a stove to make pastry since she also excels in this field. Her goal is to help her husband support the famiL., especialL. in terms of schooling and breakfast for the children.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make pastries.

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëkër Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP Sa Jëkër est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Le groupe est constitué de 12 membres. 

La présidente Déguéne, âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et a à sa charge sa maman. Elle vend des produits alimentaires et de chaussures. Le fournisseur lui amène les chaussures à domicile. Elle vend également de la bouillie mais sa ne marche pas tellement. Elle a arrêté et se consacre aux autres produits. Elle a une bonne expérience de son commerce.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter des marchandises pour renforcer son commerce. Sur la photo elle est à droite emmitouflée d'un châle noir.

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrai augmenter son épargne, préparer son remboursement et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The “ SOP Sa Jëkër  “ solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. The group consists of 12 members.
The group’s leader is Déguéne, a 36-year old woman, married and the mother of five, with her own mother also in her care.  Déguéne sells food products and shoes. The distributor delivers shoes to her home. She also sells porridge but that doesn’t work so well. She now focuses on selling other types of products instead. She has a long experience in the business.

She will use her loan to buy additional wares to bolster her business.  In the photo she is in the right wearing a black scarf. She would like to use the resulting income to grow her savings, ensure the repayment of her loan and improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to stock up on goods for bolstering her business

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois, il est composé de 26 femmes issues de différents quartiers de la ville et ont comme activité commune le petit commerce.

La responsable Ndéye Ami est âgée de 35 ans, divorcée elle est mère de deux garçons et une fille qui vivent avec leur père; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de parfums, écharpes,habits enfants....; elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 6 ans. Elle est debout à droite habillée en wax vert-orange avec des ronds blancs et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète ses produits dans la capitale et dans les villes limitrophes pour revendre dans son quartier en faisant du porte à porte.


Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter des articles à bon prix pour pouvoir tirer un bon profit en les revendant.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge ses enfants bien qu'ils soient avec leur papa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 15, 2008 when the "Village Bank" was inaugurated. It is composed of 26 women from various neighborhoods of the town who all engage in small-scale retailing. 

The group leaD., Ndéye Ami, is 35, divorced, and the mother of two sons and one daughter who live with their father. She is a small-scale retailer selling perfume, scarves, children's clothing, etc. She makes good use of her six years' experience. She is standing on the right, dressed in a green and orange African print with white circles and has raised her left hand.  

She buys her merchandise in the capital and adjacent towns and resells the goods in her neighborhood door-to-door. She intends to use her loan to buy articles at a reasonable price so that she can make a good profit when she sells them. Her goal is to support herself and her children, even though they live with their papa.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Tujyinama / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice fait partie du groupe Tujyinama. Il est née au Rwanda et a 39 ans, Il est mariée et Il a 3 enfants de 2 et 6 mois à 21 ans, aucun enfant scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
Béatrice est commerçante. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des pagnes  pour les revendre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’avoir des dépôts des pagnes pour vendre beaucoup plus en vie d’augmenter le capital. Dans les prochaines années, Béatrice voudrait devenir une grande commerçante et vendeur dans sa région, payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice is part of the group Tujyinama. She was born in Rwanda and is 39 years old. She is married and has three children, from 2 and 6 months to 21 years old. None of the children are in school. She has a 6th grade eduction. 

Béatrice is a merchant. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to resell. Her strategy for business growth is to have warehouses of pagne cloth in order to sell a lot more with the aim of increasing her capital. 

Over the next few years, Béatrice would like to become a major merchant and seller in her region, to pay for schooling for her children, and to cover the medical costs for her family.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth (pagne) to resell

loans.name: Anique Patricia

texts.fr:
Célibataire  âgée  de 47ans, mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  8 et 26ans.
Elle vendait le poisson salé au marché depuis 10 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficiée de 3 prêts avant celui-ci  qui va lui  permettre de changer d’activité car elle n a plus de table dans le marché. Elle a préféré vendre les beignet et gâteaux  à domicile et surveiller ses enfants pendant cette période des vacances.
Les bénéfices de son activité passé lui ont permis d’épargner et avec le prêt actuel, elle va acheter : 2sacs de farine, 1sac de sucre, 1bidon d’huile, 1sac de riz, 25kilo de lait en poudre, 1boite de levure, 2sac de charbons, du bois de chauffe….
A domicile elle vend le matin, en journée et le soir elle fait le riz au lait très apprécié par les enfants. Ces ventes s journalières sont comprises entre 25000f et 40.000F.
Si ses revenus et ses bénéfices augmentent, elle compte acheter un four artisanal pour fabriquer plus de gâteaux afin de les livrer.
Elle aide son marie pour soutenir la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Single, aged 47, she is the mother of five children whose ages vary between eight and 26. 

She sold salted fish in the market for 10 years. She has already received three loans before this one which will allow her to change businesses, since she no loner has a table at the marketplace. She prefers to sell doughnuts and cakes at her home and be able to watch her children during this vacation period. 

The profit from her prior business allowed her to put aside some savings and with this loan she will buy two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, one jerrycan of oil, one sack of rice, 25 kg of powdered milk, one can of baking powder, two sacks of charcoal and some firewood. 

At home she sells in the morning and during the day and in the evening she makes milk rice which is much appreciated by children. These daily sales together make between 25,000 and 40,000 francs. 

If her income and her profit grows, she intends to buy an locally made stove to make more cakes to deliver. She helps her husband keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sack of sugar, baking powder, a sack of rice, firewood, a tin of oil, powdered milk, and a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old and married to Rama. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a phone shop and distributing goods for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 5,500, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  He will use the loan to rent a permanent shop and stock up.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will use it as working capital to expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To rent a permanent shop and stock up.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pachwach in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children. Two of his children are currently in school. Gilbert has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for 7 years.         

To help expand his business, Gilbert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap, salt for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gilbert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Gilbert hopes to expand his business. Gilbert is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, salt for resale.

loans.name: Olok

texts.en:
Olok is 30 years old and lives in the town of Pachwach in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children. Two of his children are currently in school. Olok has a business of a small retail shop where he sells plates, cups, saucepans, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Olok has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase plates, cups, saucepans for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olok hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Olok hopes to expand his business. Olok is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase plates, cups, saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. One of her children is currently in school. Rose has a business of a restaurant, which she has had for 9 years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for the restaurant, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. Rose is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by easily accessing loans from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant, for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; three of his children are currently in school. James has a welding business, which he has had for eight years.         

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase metal items for making doors for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, James hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, James hopes to open another branch of the same business. 

James is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by making loan facilities accessible.

loans.use: to purchase metal items for making doors for resale.

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children.  One of his children is currently in school.  Saulo has a business of selling clothes, which he has had for 6 years.  He also sells shoes as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Saulo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Saulo hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child.  In the future, Saulo hopes to expand his business into wholesale.  Saulo is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program which has helped his prospects for the future by lending him enough money to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 5 children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  Ronald has a business of selling clothes, which he has had for 6 years.  He also sells shoes as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ronald hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Ronald hopes to open up another business.    Ronald is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by allowing him to get a loan easily, which is not the same with other institutions.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Alice has a business of a small hotel that sells food.   She has had this business for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Alice hopes to expand her business.     Alice is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business and her capital.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Baptista

texts.en:
Baptista is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Baptista has a business of selling soft drinks.  He has had this business for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Baptista has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, like water, for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Baptista hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Baptista hopes to expand his business.  Baptista is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, like water, for resale

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 32 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children.  Neither of his children is currently in school.  Jackson has a business of a bar.  He has had it for 5 years.         

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase drinks like beer and soda for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jackson hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, Jackson hopes to expand his business.  Jackson is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase drinks like beer, soda, for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and her sister's children).  

Margaret has a restaurant.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week.  Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of retail sales. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes.  She also generates additional income by selling cold drinks.

The main business challenges for Margaret include defaulters and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and see her business grow so big that she earns enough profit to build her own house. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Florence has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business.     Florence is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Susan has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for 8 years.         

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business. Susan is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing capital in her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is 37 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Night has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Night has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Night hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Night hopes to expand her business.    Night is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and onions.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school. Florence has a poultry farm, which she has had for four years. She does brick laying as her second business. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. 

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business. Florence is a member of BRAC's small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  David has a business selling timber, which he has had for 7 years.         

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, David hopes to expand his business.     

David is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 39 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. One of his children is currently in school. Geoffrey has a small retail shop, which he has had for 10 years. He does farming as his second business. 

To help expand his business, Geoffrey has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Geoffrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Geoffrey hopes to expand his business. Geoffrey is a member of BRAC's small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 23 years old and a rice farmer. He is single but supports his mother and siblings. He has been a farmer for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family and his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will purchase another piece of land. His hopes are to do large scale farming, buy land and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 49 years old and married to George. They are blessed with four children. She has been running a restaurant for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes, beans, cooking fat and expand the restaraunt. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of potatoes, beans, cooking fat and expand the restaraunt.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a green grocer business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of drought in her business. She dreams of establishing another shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables and fruits for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rachael has a business of selling firewood, which she has had for two years. 

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase firewood for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. 

In the future, Rachael hopes to own a hardware shop. Rachael is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tatu is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a juice making business for sale. She sells in a shop and from home to her neighbours. In addition, she also operates a tailoring business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase juice flavors, sugar and fruits, and also cloth materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase juice flavors, sugar and fruits, and also cloth materials.

loans.name: Akashi

texts.en:
Akashi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business, doing a manicure business, and operating from the shop and from home. She faces major challenges of competition and of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a big beauty salon business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000, she wants to purchase pedicure sets, manicure sets and lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase pedicure sets, manicure sets and lotions.

loans.name: Driscillar

texts.en:
Driscillar is a single woman who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchasing of hair chemicals for the business.

For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon business, operating in a shop where her customers are neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of products in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase hair chemicals for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Twungubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Severin  est un  commerçant âgé de 46ans qui habite   en Province de Kayanza au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de  produits alimentaires en boutique (riz,farine,haricot,sel,savon,etc) depuis 10 ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 3e année primaire. Il  est marié a Domitile et ont ensemble 9enfants dont 3 étudient. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de produits alimentaires de boutique(riz,farine,haricot,sel) à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWUNGUBUMWE II».
texts.en:
Severin is a merchant, 46 years old, who lives in the province of Kayanza in northern Burundi. He has been doing commerce in grocery items (rice, flour, beans, salt, soap, etc.) for ten years. He is also a farmer. He went to school until the third grade. He is married to Domitile, and they have nine children, of whom three are students. 

Severin is asking for a Kiva loan to increase his capital by buying a lot of goods for his shop (rice, flour, beans, salt) to sell in order to make a large profit. 

He is a member of the community group “TWUNGUBUMWE II”.

loans.use: to increase his capital by buying a lot of grocery items (rice, flour, beans, salt) for resale to make a large profit

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia nació en la ciudad de Taray de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 49  años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de comida tiene un pequeño restaurante. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Teodocia requiere el préstamo para realizar uno de sus sueños que era casarte con su pareja. 

El Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Teodacia was born in the city of Taray, which belongs to Calca province in Cusco, Peru, and she is 49 years old. She has been living in a common-law relationship from which she has three children. Currently, she is living in the city of Pisaq where she works. She has a small restaurant and sells food. She has had this business for 10 years and it is going well, thanks to her dedication to her work.

Teodocia wants the loan to make one of her dreams come true; to get married to her common-law partner.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq area of Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is well known as a tourist and commercial area, as well as for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and as the site of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu

loans.use: to make her dream of marrying her common-law partner come true.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Mariam has a business of selling soft drinks.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 6 days a week.  Mariam sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail.  Mariam has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, and passion fruits.  She also generates additional income through frying chapattis.  The main business challenges for Mariam include seasonality and thievery.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to open up another branch selling soft drinks.  Mariam lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruits

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.es:
Agrepina nació en la comunidad de Amaru del distrito de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La pueden encontrar a Agrepina  en su puesto de venta desde las 12 de la tarde hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a domingo. 

Agrepina requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carne, fideos y otras cosas más. 
 
Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Agrepina was born in the community of Amaru in the district of Pisaq (Cuzco, Perú). She is 42 years old and in a common law marriage, from which she has seven children. At present, she lives in the the city of Pisaq and she does her activity there. She sells food as a street vendor in the Plaza de Armas. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her job. Agrepina can be found at her sales stall from 12 until 3 in the afternoon Mondays through Sundays. 

Agrepina needs the loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, pasta and more.  
 
The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets on the 30th of every month in the district of Pisaq in the province of Calca (Cuzco, Perú). Cuzco is known as a very touristy and commercial area. It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because in it is one of the Seven Wonders of the World,      “Machu Picchu”.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, pasta and more.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a second-hand clothes selling business, selling from home and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during rainy season when the availability of customers purchasing clothes is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of used clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hermelinda Obdulia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Obdulia; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lencería, ella vende ropas interiores como polos y truzas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de lencería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropas interiores como polos y truzas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "CUSCO" Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Obdulia; she is 57 years old, and is single with three children.  The member combines her daily activities with her business selling underwear; she sells items such as polo shirts and men's briefs.  The member works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.  Through this business, the member is able to move her children ahead in life.

The member wants to grow and improve her business selling underwear. The member is requesting a loan to buy underwear items such as polo shirts and briefs at wholesale.  The member is happy about the loan, and promises to comply with the repayments of her share.

loans.use: to buy underwear items such as polo shirts and men's briefs at wholesale.

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Esperance, leader du groupe d’affaire « Changamuka », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 35  ans, veuve, mère de 4 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école primaire. Elle est  vendeuse de poissons (frais, fumés et salés). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal Himbi-katindo. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima.
