Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  4 paniers de poissons à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Our client, Esperance, is the leader of the business group “Changamuka”. She is a young entrepreneur, 35 years old, a widow, and the mother of four young children, who are still in primary school. Esperance sells fish (fresh, smoked, and salted). She sets up her merchandise at the communal market Himbi-katindo. She has been working in these kinds of small-scale businesses for nine years.

However, Esperance just completed eight loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve to supply her with four baskets of fish to sell. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her enterprise. 

Our client thanks Hekima for the actions it takes in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to pay for 4 baskets of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Antonieta; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de buzos, ella confecciona polos, shorts y pantalones y también se dedica al negocio de refrigerios como llevar sándwich, gaseosas y pasteles a los diferentes colegios de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de confección de buzos y ampliar el negocio de venta de refrigerios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los buzos y también comprar productos para los refrigerios como panes, pollos y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Antonieta belongs to the “Cusco” Communal Bank, which is located in the district and province of Cusco. She is 43 and a single mother with 3 children.

Sra. Maria Antonieta divides her daily activities between making sportswear, shorts and pants and her business selling snacks, where she takes sandwiches, soft drinks and pastries to the different schools in Cusco. She wants to expand her business making sportswear and also her business selling snacks. She will use the loan to buy material to make sportwear and also to buy products for her snacks such as bread, chicken and vegetables.

She is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy material to make sportswear and also to buy products for snacks such as bread, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.fr:
Consolate  est une  commerçante âgée de 38ans qui habite   en Province de Kayanza au Nord du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de  produits alimentaires (haricot,petit pois,ble) depuis 6 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle n’a pas  fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée a Jean et ont ensemble 4enfants qui étudient au secondaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de produits alimentaires (haricot,petit pois,ble) à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUPENDANE».
texts.en:
Consolate is a merchant, 38 years old, who lives in the province of Kayanza in northern Burundi. She has been doing commerce in groceries (beans peas, wheat) for six years. She is also a farmer. She did not attend school. She is married to Jean, and together they have four children who are in middle school. 

Consolate is asking for a Kiva loan to increase her capital and to buy a lot of grocery items (beans, peas, wheat) to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Consolate is a member of the community group “TUPENDANE”.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying a lot of grocery items (beans, peas, wheat) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Sonia Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia Sabina; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes, ella es propietaria de una agencia de viajes, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar e implementar el negocio de agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la agencia como repuestos de computadoras para comprar sillas para la agencia.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “CUSCO.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of  Cusco.

The member is Sonia Sabina. She is 41 years old and is married with three children. The member alternates her daily activities with her travel agency business. She is the owner of a travel agency. She works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. Through this business she is able to raise her children. The member would like expand and establish her travel agency. The member asks for a loan to buy computer spare parts and chairs to keep her business up and running. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts and chairs to keep her travel agency up and running.

loans.name: Nouvelle Vision Plus Group

texts.en:
Nouvelle Vision Plus is a community bank group which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. It is located in Kinshasa. 

Pascal sells lamp oil. He has been in business since 1994. His beginning capital was $50. With hard work and determination, and after he joined one of Hope’s groups called “Nouvelle Vision Plus,” his business has prospered. Through his sales, Pascal makes about $60 per week. He plans to use the coming loan from Hope to increase his inventory by purchasing more liters of lamp oil for reselling at profit in order to increase his income.

 Pascal has points of sale within his community. He dreams someday of being an important lamp oil provider in his environment. Pascal is 48 years old, married and the father of two children whose ages are 5 and 18. Both of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase more lamp oil to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widowed woman with two children,  both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and establish a stall at the market to sell clothes. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with six children; two attend school while four are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and charcoal.  

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also owns real estate houses, her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other charcoal operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Dusabimana Group

texts.fr:
Imelde  est une commerçante  âgée de 32 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Gihamagara en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires de boutique comme la farine de manioc,le haricot,le riz,les biscuits... depuis 8 ans.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est mariée  à Gerard qui fait lui aussi le commerce de produits de boutique.Ils ont ensemble 3 enfants  dont  1 étudie a l’école primaire.
 Le crédit de Kiva de 200000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires de boutique(farine de manioc,haricot,riz,biscuits,etc) à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “DUSABIMANA”
texts.en:
Melde is a merchant, 32 years old, who lives in the town of Gihamagara in the province of Gitega. She has been selling grocery items, such as cassava flour, beans, rice, cookies... for eight years. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married to Gerard, who is also a grocer. Together, they have three children, of whom one is in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 200,000 Fbu is going to enable Melde to increase her capital in order to buy a lot of grocery items (cassava flour, beans, rice, cookies, etc.) to resell in order to make a large profit.

Melde is a member of the community group "DUSABIMANA"

loans.use: to increase capital in order to buy a lot of grocery items (cassava flour, beans, rice, cookies, etc.) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Fondation Plus Group

texts.en:
"Fondation Plus" is a community bank made up of nine members whose chairwoman is Marceline. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Marceline makes and sells doughnuts. She began her business in 2003. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. 

Marceline is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of the inputs with her next loan by buying wheat flour, yeast and vegetable oil for making doughnuts and reselling them at profit. Marceline is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children, whose ages vary between 17 and 23 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, yeast and vegetable oil for making doughnuts to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cristian

texts.en:
Cristian is a member of  "The Endeavour" Communal Bank located in the Traiguén neighborhood in the city of Temuco. He has been working as a street vendor for 7 years, selling a variety of products from his car outside of a store. He says that during this time his sales have been very good and he now has a large number of dedicated clients.  Cristian also always gives credit to some of his most responsible, and also elderly clients, allowing them to make payments on the goods that they would like to purchase.  

Cristian works from 8am to 5pm Monday through Saturday and eats his lunch while working.  He prefers to purchase the majority of his merchandise from distributors located in the capital city of Santiago.  He did comment that while he prefers to buy in Santiago he incurs more costs to pay for transportation and custody of the products.

Cristian will use the loan to buy new merchandise with the goal of changing some of his current products and restocking; he would also like to start selling some natural remedies. Sales in Traiguén are slower, so he would also like to find a place to sell in the center of Temuco. 

Cristian is single and lives with his mother, two brothers and a niece. Their dreams are to travel abroad to experience other cultures and landscapes. He is very happy and grateful for the assistance provided by Fondo Esperanza; he enjoys sharing experiences with other people and has learned new things to help his business.  
 
Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía, located 670 km south of Santiago. There are a number of lakes (Pucón, Villarrica) located nearby Temuco, as well as parks filled with striking fauna and flora. Half of the Mapuche indigenous population also lives in this region.

loans.use: to purchase and restock merchandise

loans.name: Thikay Maya

texts.en:
Thikay Maya is 40 years-old. She is married and has two children aged 17 and 12.  In 2001, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Thikay Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve her living standard, extra training is needed. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with five children. Two of his children attend school and three have graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, he has operated a business buying and selling farm products at the market to her his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Adama Alassane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a reçu une formation en pâtisserie et gestion de boulangerie.Il s'est installé à son compte et la position de sa boulangerie, située dans un grand carrefour lui a permis de gagner des marchés dans des établissement touristiques et restaurants de la place.Il es le principal soutien d'une famille très large et dont la majorité des jeunes sont dans le chômage.Ce qui fait qu'il dépenses toutes ses bénéfices dans l'entretien de ses deux parents et de ses frères et sœurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000F pour renforcer son stock en achetant des sacs de farines, de la levure, du sucre et du sel iodé. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une grande alimentation dans sa localité.
texts.en:
This young man was trained to make pastries and to manage a bakery. He started his own business and his bakery, located in a major hub, has allowed him to build a clientele through the tourist attractions and restaurants of the area. 

He is the main support of a very large family whose youth are mostly unemployed. As a result, he uses all his profits to take care of his parents and siblings. 

He is seeking a loan of 250, 000F to replenish his stock by purchasing sacks of flour, yeast, sugar and iodized salt. His goal is to open a large food store in his neighborhood

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, yeast, sugar and iodized salt

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past six years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions to his neighbors and passersby. He also sells farm products, which contributes to his other source of income. Suleiman faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa vive con su acompañante de vida, no tiene hijos sus planes son mejorar la vivienda, trabaja como comerciante desde hace tiempo el principal problema ha sido el alza  de energía. Su proyecto expandir su negocio con mayores cantidades de productos. El préstamo se invertirá en la compra de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabones de baño, lavar trastos y lavar ropa entre otros productos de uso cotidiano.
Obteniendo mayores ganancias y así seguir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her companion in life. They do not have children, but they have plans to improve their home. Rosa has worked as a merchant for some time, but her main problem has been rising energy costs. Her project involves expanding her business with a larger quantity of products.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as rice, beans, oil, bath soaps, dishwashing soaps, laundry detergents, and other daily use products. As a result, Rosa will earn more income so that she can continue improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, bath soaps, dishwashing soaps, laundry detergents, and other daily use products.

loans.name: Dhanmaya

texts.en:
Dhanmaya is 38 years old. She is married and has two children aged 17 and 13.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working six days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Dhanmaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve her living standard, extra training is needed.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a business of buying and selling farm products. Kyalo sells at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Kyalo dreams of expanding and operating as wholesale in the future.

With the KSHS 25,000, he wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, oranges and maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts, oranges and maize for resale.

loans.name: Adriana Alejandra

texts.es:
La Señora Adrián Alejandra y su esposo el señor José Adrián son padres de familia y tiene tres hijos adolescentes que están estudiando.
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar el pago de la inscripción y la compra de uniformes y los útiles escolares que son (Cuadernos, libros, lápices, plumas y carpetas). 
Planea pagar el crédito con  el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía de lavado y planchado de ropa. Ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como técnico eléctrico de una compañía. 
Doña Adriana Y Don José desean que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro en su vida y que terminen una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Adriana Alejandra and her husband Sr. José Adrián are the parents of three teenage children who are in school. They are requesting a loan because they do not have the necessary funds to pay for tuition, uniforms, and school supplies (notebooks, books, pencils, pens, and folders).

She plans to repay the loan with the income she earns from her job at a company that washes and irons clothes. Her husband will take charge of the family expenses with the salary that he receives working for a company as an electrician.

Doña Adriana and Don José want their children to have a better future in life and to finish their professional degrees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, uniforms, and school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a posho mill business. Her potential customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fuel. She dreams of purchasing another posho mill in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase diesel fuel and service her posho mill machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel fuel and service her posho mill machine.

loans.name: Duhuze Group

texts.fr:
Samuel  est un  commerçant âgé de 34ans qui habite   en Province de Ngozi au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de chèvres depuis 3 ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Il  est marié a Séraphine et ont ensemble 4enfants dont 1 étudie en 1ere année primaire.

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de chèvres à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUHUZE».
texts.en:
Samuel is a 34 year old retailer who lives in Ngozi Province in North Burundi. he has been trading goats for 3 years. He is also a farmer. He attended primary school until 5th grade. He is married to Séraphine with whom he has 4 children, one of whom is in 1st grade at primary school.

He is requesting Kiva credit to increase his capital so that he can buy lots of goats to resell and maximise his profits.
He is member of the community group "DUHUZE

loans.use: purchase goats which he can resell to make a profit.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 38 años, es una mujer alegre, emprendedora y sobre todo muy responsable, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa de sus suegros.El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas, lleva realizando este trabajo ya por cuatro años lo hace sola y dice que el clima de la región le da muchas ganancias, ya que siempre hay clientes buscando refrescarse ante el incremento del calor en la ciudad.Lo que le gusta d su trabajo es que siempre hay clientes, siempre esta en actividad y sobre todo tiene tiempo para poder hacer otras cosas y otras actividades que le generen mas ganancia. Ella espera poder mas adelante hacer crecer su negocio, poner una fuente de soda o al menos poco a poco poder ir incrementando su stock.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre MFP y Rosa, le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo ya que todos se muestran responsables, espera poder seguir trabajando de esta manera con ellos y con la institución de quien esta muy agradecida ya que siente que le apoyan mucho.Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles ella comprará mas bebidas para poder ampliar su negocio y asi poder crecer junto a MFP.
texts.en: Rosa is 38 years old. She is a cheerful, enterprising and above all responsible woman. She lives with her husband and two children in her parents in law's house. Rosa's work is selling soft drinks. She has been doing this for four years and she says that the regional climate brings her a lot of earnings, since there are always customers looking for refreshment with the rising heat in the city. What she likes about her job is that there are always customers and there is always activities that generate more income. She hopes in the future to be able to grow her business, opening a soda fountain or at least little by little increase her stock. This is her fourth loan with MFP and Rosa really likes working with her group since everyone is responsible. She hopes to be able to continue working in this way with them and with the institution to which she is very grateful since she feels it supports her a lot. With the amount she has asked for, 2,500 soles, she will buy more beverages to expand her business and thus be able to grow with MFP.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to expand her business and grow with MFP.

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is 30 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 3.  In 2002, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 5 loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to increase inventory of the store.  In the future, Ganga plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Magda; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende chompas, polos, pantalones, muñecas y llaveros, la socia vende la artesanía en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la venta de artesanía como chompas, muñecas y llaveros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “CUSCO” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Magda.  She is 41 years of age and single with one son.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the business of selling artesan crafts.  She sells sweaters, shirts, pants, bracelets and key rings.  She sells the crafts on foot from 8AM to 7PM.  By means of this business she helps her son move ahead.  The associate would like to grow her business of selling crafts.  She requests a loan to be able to sell artesan crafts such as sweaters, bracelets and key rings.  

 The associate is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to offer crafts for sale such as sweaters, bracelets and key rings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy 25 bags and 45 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de publicidad, ella hace letreros, folletos, almanaques y afiches, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de publicidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como papeles, cartulinas y pegamentos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “CUSCO” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Gladys.  She is 39 years of age and single with 2 children.  The associate alternates her daily activities with a publicity business.  She makes signs, pamphlets, almanacs and  posters.  She works from 8AM to 7PM.  By means of this business the associate raises her children.  The associate wants to grow and improve her publicity business.  She requests the loan to buy materials such as paper, posterboard and adhesives.  

 The associate is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as paper, posterboard and adhesives

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Adela; tiene 42 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos; el conyugue de la socia trabaja vendiendo zapatillas y la socia le apoya en la compra de mercadería y también en la venta; La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y junto a sus conyugue ahorran el dinero que les ingresa de las ventas y pagan las cuentas de casa y los estudios de sus hijos, la socia algunas veces viaja a traer la mercadería a Juliaca o a Lima, y otras veces va su conyugue, los dos también venden turnándose los horarios y en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mercadería, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete con cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “FUENTE DE VIDA” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The associate, Adela, is 42 years of age and lives in a shared home.  She has 4 children.  Her partner works selling shoes and she supports him by purchasing the merchandise and also selling shoes.  The associate is a very hard-working woman and, along with her partner, saves the money that they earn from the sales to pay for the household expenses  and the studies of her children.  The associate sometimes travels to bring the merchandise to Juliaca or to Lima.  At other times her partner goes.  The two also sell by taking turns on the schedule.  On this occasion the associate desires to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise. The associate requests the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise.
  
 The associate is happy for the support offered and promises to comply with the payment schedule in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kelly Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kelly Edith; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un camión que hace servicios de carga pesada llevando frutas, verduras al por mayor a diferentes lugares como puerto Maldonado y Sicuani, la socia también se dedica al negocio de música junto con su esposo y que él es cantor de un grupo musical, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento del camión como para comprar repuestos de carro y también para comprar llantas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank "Cusco." The bank is located in the district of Cusco,  which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Kelly Edith. She is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her transport business. She has a truck which provides heavy cargo service, carrying wholesale loads of fruits and vegetables to places such as Puerto Maldonado and Sicuani. She also works with her husband in the music business. He is a singer in a musical group. Through these businesses, this bank member is raising her children. She is applying for the loan to maintain her truck by buying spare parts and also tires.

This communal bank member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to maintain her truck by buying spare parts and also tires.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Avec un appui de 30000F de son mari,elle a commencé un commerce de produits vestimentaires et de chaussures.Elle place ainsi ses produits à crédit et se fait payer au bout d'un mois.Elle a aussi reçu une formation en coiffure et pratique cette activité à domicile.Elle dispose par ailleurs de deux jardins ou elle cultive des légumes destinés à la vente.Toutes ces activités lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins, ceux de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses alimentaires.Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F pour acheter à l'occasion des fetes, 50 pièces d'habits pour enfants et 50 pièces d'habits pour adultes. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un salon de coiffure.
texts.en: The borrower is a married women who is mother of 2 children. With 30000F support from her husband, she began a business selling clothing and shoes. She places her products on credit with a monthly payback period. She is also a trained hairdresser and works from home. She has two gardens where she grows vegetables to sell. All these activities enable her to provide for her needs and those of her children, and to support her husband with the food expenses. She is requesting a loan of 100000F to buy 50 children's clothing garments and 50 adult's clothing garments. Her ambition is to open a hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy 100 clothing garments

loans.name: Nuevas Lideres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS LIDERES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nemesia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ropa. 

La señora Nemesia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida desde hace doce años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra platos, garrafa, cocina y un puesto de venta, ya que quiere expandir su negocio y vender en otro puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Nuevas Líderes" ["New Leaders"] communal bank will be starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela Center. The group is comprised of six members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Ms. Nemesia. The members of this communal bank work in a variety of businesses. Among them we have: sweets sales, food sales, cosmetics sales, a neighborhood store and clothing sales.

Ms. Nemesia indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, which she did through an invitation from one of her friends. She currently has a food sales business that she has run for 12 years.

The loan that she will take out is for purchasing plates, carafes, a stove and a food stall, as she would like to expand her business and sell from another stall. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nemesia responds that she likes the educational sessions and the savings.

loans.use: to buy plates, carafes and a food stand

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bordados, la socia trabaja haciendo trabajos de bordados como manteles,cojines,alfombras entre otros trabajos, ella borda en hilos y lana y luego los vende al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas que vende estos trabajos, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para el comprar materiales como hilos, lanas y agujas para hacer los bordados.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Cusco." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Marisol. She is 28 years old and is married. She has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her embroidery business. She embroiders such items as tablecloths, pillows, and rugs, among other items. She embroiders in thread and wool and then sells her items wholesale in the different shops that sell these items. She works from 7 am until 8 pm. Through this business she is raising her children. She wants to expand and improve her embroidery business. She is applying for the loan to buy materials such as thread, wool, and needles to do embroidery.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, wool, and needles to do embroidery

loans.name: Déthié

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui cultive le mil, l'arachide et pratique le maraichage en saison sèche.En saison des pluies, il achete des vaches et des moutons qu'il engraisse et revend sur le marché local.Cette diversité de ses activités lui permet de prendre en charge son épouse et ses deux enfants.Il sollicite un pret de 150000F pour acheter 4 moutons à 20000F l'un et 2 sacs d'aliment bétail ainsi que des tourtereaux d'arachide pour leur nourriture.Bien engraissés, les moutons seront vendus 60000F l'un et devront lui procurer des revenus assez consistants pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et d'aliments de bétail.
texts.en:
This borrower is a peasant farmer who grows millet and peanuts and who operates market garden during the dry season. During the rainy season, he buys cows and sheep, and he fattens and resell them on the market. This diversity in his businesses enables him to support his wife and his two children. 

He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy 4 heads of sheep at 20,000 francs each and 2 sacks of feed, as well as some peanut meal, to feed them. When they are fattened enough, the sheep will be sold at 60,000 francs each and should bring in the revenues substantial enough to improve his family’s living conditions. His ambition is to open a shop selling grocery items and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy 4 heads of sheep at 20,000 francs each and 2 sacks of feed, as well as peanut meal, to feed them

loans.name: Ayde De Jesús

texts.es:
Ayde es una mujer luchadora que siempre ha contribuido con el cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar, oficios como la venta de productos por catálogo así como de comidas han sido algunos de sus negocios. Desde hace algún tiempo en la terraza de su casa acondicionó un galpón de pollos con el fin de vender diariamente los huevos. 

Actualmente Ayde necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones al galpón y así poder llegar a acomodar más gallinas que le permitan mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ayde is a hard-working woman who has always contributed to the household expenses.  She has had businesses such as selling products through catalogs, and also selling prepared food.  Some time ago she fixed up a chicken coop on the terrace of her house so that she could sell eggs every day.

Now Ayde needs a loan for some improvements to the coop so that she can accommodate more hens to improve her sales.

loans.use: to renovate the chicken coop

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalbina; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también hace platos como pollo al horno, tallarines y sopas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “CUSCO.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Rosalbina. She is 28 years old, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She also has entrees like baked chicken, noodles, and soups. She works from 7:00 a.m until 8:00 p.m. Through this business she is able to raise her children. She would like to expand the restaurant. She asks for a loan to buy products to cook like chicken, meat, and vegetables. 

She is happy because of this loan, and she promises to comply with the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy products to cook like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yoni; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara caldos como caldo de pollo, caldo de carne entre otros caldos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de caldos. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el local como comprar sillas y mesas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Yoni belongs to the “Cusco” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to Cusco province and department.

She is 28, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Her daily activities are devoted to her restaurant business for which she prepares soups, such as chicken soup and beef bouillon among others. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. With this business she has been able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand and improve her business selling soups. She is requesting a loan to fix up the premises such as by buying tables and chairs.

Yoni is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy items such as tables and chairs to fix up her restaurant.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune garçon qui habite dans un village , non loin d'une grande ville dans laquelle il est employé comme chauffeur de taxi.Ne parvenant pas à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, il décide d'hadérer à l'UIMCEC pour accéder au crédit afin d'acquérir son propre véhicule.Il se lance également dans l'élevage pour accroitre son épargne et rassembler les fonds nécessaires à un crédit consistant.C'est dans ce cadre qu'il sollicite un pret de 250000F pour acheter un boeuf et de l'aliment bétail concentré à 50000F. Les revenus tirés de la vente de ce boeuf lui permettront de participer à l'alimentation de la famille d'une part mais serviront en grande partie à obtenir un pret pour l'achat d'un véhicule.
texts.en: This borrower is a young man who lives in a village near a large city where he is employed as a taxi driver. Unable to improve his family’s living conditions, he decided to join the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to access credit in order to acquire his own vehicle. He has also started raising livestock to increase his savings and to gather the funds necessary for a substantial loan. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a head of cattle and 50,000 francs of feed concentrate. The revenues from the sale of this livestock will enable him to help feed his family but also help to obtain a loan for buying a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle and some concentrated feed at 50,000 francs

loans.name: Tania Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania Elizabeth; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas y cuyes y también tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz, ella tanto los animales como el maíz lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y para comprar fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI.” The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Tania Elizabeth. She is 28 years old and lives with her partner and their 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business breeding animals like chickens and guinea pigs. She also has a plot of land where she grows corn. She sells both the animals and the corn by walking through the Urubamba market. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. Through this business she is able to provide for her children. She would like a loan to expand and improve her business of breeding animals and selling corn. She asks for a loan to buy food for the animals and the buy fertilizer for the farm land. 

This loan makes her happy, and she promises to comply with the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy food for the animals and to buy fertilizer for the farm land.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une enseignante à l'école primaire de son villaget .Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant dont elle a  la charge ainsi que sa propre mère.En marge de l'enseignement, elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de produits vestimentaires sur un premier pret de l'UIMCEC de 100000F. Son activité lui permet de s'occuper  de sa fille, de sa mère et de payer la location de sa boutique.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter 20 pieces d'habits pour enfants, 20 paires de chaussures , 15 coupons de tissus ainsi que des pièces diverses. Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
This borrower is a teacher at her village’s grade school. She is married and the mother of a child, her own, who she supports. Aside from teaching, she opened a store selling clothing with an initial loan of 100,000 francs from U-IMCEC. Her business enables her to take care of her daughter and her mother and to pay the rent for her store. 

In order to increase her working capital, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy 20 pieces of children’s clothing, 20 pairs of shoes, and 15 samples of fabrics, as well as various items. Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces children's clothing, 20 pairs of shoes, 15 samples of cloth, as well as assorted items

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Javier; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos, el socio tiene un kiosco en el mercado de Urubamba, el socio vende zapatos de mujeres, varones y niños, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This bank member is a member of the communal bank "José Carlos Mariategui," which is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

He is Sr. Javier. He is 40 years old and is married, with two children. He alternates his daily activities with his shoe business. He has a kiosk in the market of Urubamba. He sells shoes for women, men, and children. He works from 7 am to 7 pm. Through this business, he is raising his children. He wants to enlarge his shoe business. He is applying for the loan to buy shoes wholesale.

This bank member is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y fruta de esta hermosa unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de fruta y solo distribuye sus productos los días viernes pues no tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de Racsa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella compra la fruta de la ciudad de Yanatile. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Inés también tiene un bus que brinda servicio de transporte interprovincial a la ciudad de Yanatile Cusco y viceversa.  

Inés requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del Carro.

Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Inés was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 42 years old. She is married and from this beautiful union has four children. She now lives in the same city where she was born and where she has her business. She sells fruit and only distributes her products on Fridays, since she doesn't have a sales stall in the Racsa market in the city of Cusco. She buys fruit in the city of Yanatile. She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Inés also has a bus, with which she offers interprovincial transportation service between the cities of Yantile and Cusco.

Inés needs the loan to maintain her car.

The communal bank "Siempre Adelante" (Always Forward) meets every month in the district of Pisaq in the province of Calca (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristic and commerical area, for its traditional fiesta of Into Raymi, and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found there.

loans.use: to maintain her car.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE D. VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Fortunata; tiene 54 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos los cuales son independientes; La  socia  trabaja con la venta D. alimentos ella tiene una picantería en la cual venD. todo tipo D. extras que son comidas típicas D. la región y también chica D. maíz llamada chicha D. jora, también la socia produce una chicha rosada a base D. frutillada la cual la llaman frutillada; La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. carne y papas al por mayor para incrementar sus ventas. La socia solicita el préstamo en la compra D. papa al por mayor y carne para elaborar los diferentes platos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "FUENTE D. VIDA.” The bank is located in the District of Huanchac, in the Province of Cusco and the Departmento of Cusco.

The member Fortunata is 54 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are grown. She works selling food, and she has a restaurant in which she sells every type of special local cuisine and also corn drink called "chicha D. jora." She also makes a pink drink maD. from strawberries which is called "frutillada." She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of wholesale meat and potatoes to increase her sales. She asks for a loan to purchase wholesale potatoes and meat to prepare various entrees. 

She is grateful for the support which has been given to her and she also promises to comply with the terms of the agreement in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes and meat to prepare various dishes.

loans.name: Afandina

texts.fr:
Afandina est une femme agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est chauffeur. Elle a deux enfants,
Afandina travaille comme revendeuse de poissons fumés depuis 1981. Elle achète et revend ses poissons à ses clients dans la ville de Lomé. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite est son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Afandina, 43, is married to a driver. She has two children. 

Afandina has worked at selling smoked fish since 1981. She buys and re-sells her fish to her customers in the local market of Atikpodji. This is her second loan. She buys her merchandise in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mamadou  Cheikh

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un menuisier ébéniste qui a déja capitalisé une expérience de 15 ans.Il vend en même temps des feuilles de zinc pour la toiture et du bois de construction.Il est marié et père de deux enfants.L'entretien de sa famille est essentiellement basé sur son activité.Il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un prêt de 300000F pour acheter 10 paquets de zing et du bois. Son ambition est de construire son propre magasin et d'augmenter son matériel de travail.
texts.en: The borrower is a carpenter and cabinetmarker who has already gained 15 years experience. He also sells zinc metal for roofing and timber for construction. He is married and father of two children. The support of his family is essentially based on his business activity. He is requesting a loan of 30000 from the UIMCEC to buy 10 batches of zing and some wood. His goal is to construct his own shop and to increase his working material.

loans.use: to buy 10 batches of zing and some wood

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Josefa casada, su esposo artesano plástico, su hijo mayor de edad trabaja por cuenta propia, unas de su planes es la compra de una máquina de coser siendo un ingreso mas al hogar y también adquirir un motor de mayor capacidad para agilizar la producción. Nuestra clienta trabaja como artesana de plástico junto a su esposo, lo iniciaron hace tiempo atrás siendo su principal fuente de trabajo. Con el préstamo comprara materia prima como: plástico para elaborar taza de pocillos, platos, vasos, panas entre otros productos. Siendo vendido en los distintos mercados del país. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa is married. Her husband produces handmade plastics while her grown son is self-employed. One of her plans is to buy a sewing machine so that she can earn more household income. She also wants to acquire a motor with more horsepower to speed up production.

Josefa manufactures handmade plastics along with her husband. They started this business a long time ago as their main source of work. With this loan, Josefa will buy raw materials such as plastic for making cups and saucers, plates, glasses, wash bowls, and other products to sell in different markets throughout the country. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support so that she can develop her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making plastic goods.

loans.name: Rosas De Saron Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE SARON” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Inés. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Confección de polleras, tejido de mantas a máquina, venta de colchones, venta de regalos, venta de accesorios de celular, venta de edredones. 

La señora Inés,  indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchones desde hace tres años, el que aprendió de una amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de colchones), el que adquiere de la feria 16 de julio y lo comercializa en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosas de Saron” (Roses of Sharon) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Inés. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as making skirts, weaving blankets with machines, selling mattresses, selling gifts, selling mobile phone accessories, and selling quilts.

Sra. Inés says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by one of her friends. At the moment, she has a business selling mattresses that has been in operation for three years. She learned this trade from a friend.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying mattresses. She acquires her merchandise at the July 16th fair and then sells these products from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Inés is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Inés said that she enjoys the training classes and the savings.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Hector Emilio

texts.es:
Héctor es un señor de 26 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Las Bonitas de Platanares, localizada en Pérez Zeledón esto en la provincia de San Jose. Es una zona donde se presenta la actividad agropecuaria, los habitantes de la región en su mayoría son productores de café y de ganado doble propósito.

El tiene el apoyo de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Héctor Emilio es un micro crédito de ¢500,000(quinientos mil colones), para compra de cerdos para engorde, para obtener un mejor resultado en su proyecto.

Don Héctor Emilio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de las Bonitas, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas, y se tiene más información y acceso a créditos ya que con las entidades bancarias es muy difícil.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 26-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and children in the community of Las Bonitas de Platanares, which is located in Pérez Zeledón in the Province of San Jose. This is an agricultural area, so most of the residents in this region are coffee producers and livestock breeders.

Héctor has the support of his wife, which makes it easier for him to continue with his project. In addition to being very interesting work, his business has grown gradually and the demand gets stronger each time. His neighbors in the community are satisfied with the service that he provides.

At the moment, Don Héctor Emilio is requesting a microloan in the amount of 500,000 CRC in order to buy pigs for fattening so that he can obtain a better result in his project.

Don Héctor Emilio is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Las Bonitas, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. With this loan, he hopes to grow on a personal and financial level. In addition, he expresses his appreciation to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that devote a great amount of time to productive activities. Having more information and getting access to credit is usually very difficult with the banking institutions.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Ancizar

texts.es:
Ancizar trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche y aunque su jornada laboral es larga, este emprendedor es consciente de que así logrará salir adelante y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Su negocio es una tienda en la que además de ofrecer productos de la canasta familiar también ofrece productos propios de ferretería. 

Actualmente este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de productos y así mejorar su oferta para sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ancizar works Sunday to Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night and even though his work day is long, this entrepreneur is aware of what he needs to do to get ahead and give his family a better quality of life.  He runs a store for a living and, in addition to offering household products, he also sells hardware.  Currently, he needs a loan to buy a greater variety of products so he can improve what he offers to his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: purchase household products and hardware to stock his store.

loans.name: Ndane Ndeb

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui tient une petite boutique au bord de la route goudronnée qui traverse son village.Elle a 7 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école.Pour mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de  sa famille, elle cultive durant l'hivernage un champs de mil et un champs d'arachide.Elle est membre de l'UIMCEC et sollicite un pret de 250000F pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.Elle compte acheter 10 sacs de riz, 100 litres d'huile et des produits divers.Elle ambitionne d'élargir son magasin et de construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman with a little shop on the side of the sealed road which runs through her village. She has 7 children and they all attend school. To further improve the living conditions of her family she cultivates millet and peanuts during the winter months. She is a member of the UIMCEC and requests a loan of 250000F in order to increase her business capital. She intends to buy 10 bags of rice, 100 litres of oil and various other products. Her goal is to expand her shop and to eventually construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of rice, 100 litres of oil and other products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 49 años, es madre de tres hijos, vive con ellos en su casa propia además de su madre y padre, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de cuzco ya hace varios años y es por eso que ella tiene que velar por la educación de sus hijos que están a su lado.
El trabajo de Gladys consiste en la compra de productos gaseosos para su posterior venta, ella realiza esta actividad sola en su casa y ya son casi 2 años desde que decidió iniciar con este trabajo que hasta el momento le ayudo bastante en la economía y generando ingresos en su hogar.Lo que mas le gusta a Gladys de su trabajo es tiene tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además de poder generar ingresos extras a su hogar ella puede disponer de su tiempo, lo que no le gusta es que a veces hay gente que quiere crédito y se demoran en pagar, lo bueno dice ella es que siempre hay clientes con ganas de refrescarse ante el calor intenso que en estas épocas hace en nuestra ciudad.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Gladys y la institución MF]P, se siente cómoda trabajando con nosotros MFP ya que siente que los intereses son muy bajos además de poder acceder a un seguro a muy bajo costo. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas bebidas gaseosas para poder tener en stcok en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and the mother of three children. She and her family live in their own home along with her mother and father. Her husband has worked in the city of Cusco for several years. For this reason, she has been left with the responsibility of securing education for her children who have been by her side.

Her work involves buying sodas for eventual resale. Gladys manages her business alone from home and has been performing this type of work for almost two years. She decided to start this business to generate household income because she needed help with the finances. What she enjoys most about her work is having time to engage in other activities. As a result, she is able to generate extra income from home because she can devote the time. What she does not like is that sometimes there are customers who ask for credit but then are slow in repaying. She says the best thing is that she always has customers who are eager to cool off because of the intense heat around this time of year in the city.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels comfortable working with MFP because of the low interest rates and affordable insurance. The amount of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy sodas in order to restock her business.

loans.use: to buy sodas.

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr:
Délali est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé au port. Elle a trois (3) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.  
Délali travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle achète et revend des détergents et insecticide de façon ambulante. Elle travaille seule dans son commerce. 
Délali a requis son 3ème crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des insecticides et des détergents. Elle veut investir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Délali voudrait commencer le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en: Délali is a 33-year old woman.  She is married to a port employee. She has three children who all attend school.  The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 5 years old.  Délali has been working as a retailer since 2004.  She buys and resells detergents and insecticides door-to-door.  She works alone in her business.  Délali is requesting her third loan from WAGES in order to buy insecticides and detergents.  She wants to invest in her business.  In the coming years, Délali would like to open a general store.

loans.use: to buy detergents and insecticides.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza toda su vida ha trabajo en negocio de arepas gracias a que su familia siempre ha trabajado en este negocio, sin embargo desde hace un tiempo ella tiene su propio negocios para así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, además porque su sueño es poder tener una gran empresa distribuidora de arepas en la región.
texts.en: All her life Esperanza has worked making arepas [pancake-like bread made from corn].  Thanks to her family she has always worked in this business.  However, she has had her own business for a while now to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  Her dream is to be able to have a large arepa distributing business in the region.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle to make home deliveries.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune menuisier métallique.En association avec un ami, il a ouvert un atelier dans sa localité.Pour augmenter ses revenus et mieux participer à la prise en charge alimentaire de sa famille, il investit  dans l'élevage de poulets. Il pratique ainsi l'aviculture et l'embouche ovine.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 75000F auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 30 poulets et 1 mouton.Son ambition est de construire un poulailler.
texts.en: The borrrower is a young metalworker. In collaboration with a friend, he opened a workshop in his village. To increase his revenue and to better support his family's food requirements, he has begun farming chickens. He is involved in both aviculture and sheep fattening. Today he is requesting a loan of 75000F from the UIMCEC to buy 30 chickens and 1 sheep. His aim is to construct a henhouse.

loans.use: to buy 30 chickens and one sheep

loans.name: Janvier

texts.fr:
Janvier est né au Rwanda et a 29 ans. Il est marié et il a 4 enfants de 2 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. 

C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter une moto utilisée comme taxi-moto. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’épargner beaucoup et travailler beaucoup d’heures par jour pour augmenter le capital. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et améliorer le bien être de sa famille. Dans les prochaines années, Janvier voudrait bâtir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Janvier was born in Rwanda and is 29 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 2 and 9 years, 2 of whom attend school.
It is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy a motorbike in order to provide taxi services.
His growth strategy for the business is to work many hours a day and save lots to increase his capital. With the profits, he intends to pay his children's school fees and to improve the wellbeing of his family. In the next few years, Janvier would like to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike in order to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Alvaro Octavio

texts.es:
Alvaro conoce muy bien la ley del rebusque, pues desde hace más de 20 años se ha dedicado a trabajar como independiente. Actualmente y después de quebrarse en su negocio anterior de confecciones debido a que sus clientes en muchas ocasiones no le pagaron, con la ayuda de un amigo puso un punto de venta de ropa en el centro de Medellín. 

Este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar diversidad de mercancía y así ofrecerle otros productos a sus clientes y mejorar así sus ventas.
texts.en: Alvaro knows very well the law of earning a living as he has more than 20 years of experience being self-employed.   Currently, and after his previous tailoring business went bankrupt because many times his customers didn't pay him, he set up a clothing sales business with the help of a friend in downtown Medellín.  This entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a variety of merchandise so he can have more products to offer his customers and improve his sales.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene la edad de18 de años, está soltera y vive actualmente con sus padres y sus hermanos. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar una computadora de tipo portátil para facilitar sus estudios. Ella actualmente se encuentra realizando sus estudios para fortalecer su nivel académico. Ella quiere con esta compra de esta computadora facilitar sus estudios y así poder tener un mejor rendimiento académico. Ella quiere llegar a ser una profesional y cumplir varios proyectos de vida para su futuro. Al igual piensa darles una ayuda extra a sus padres cuando se desempeñe con su profesión en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosario is 18 years old, single and currently lives with her parents and siblings.  With the loan she intends to buy a portable computer to facilitate her studies.  She is currently studying to strengthen her academic level.  With the purchase of this computer she wants to facilitate her studies and be able improve her academic performance.  She wants to become a professional and fulfill various life plans she has for her future.  She also plans to help her parents when she is employed in her future profession.  

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't had any previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with an easy payment plan and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Johana

texts.es: Johana es una joven emprendedora quien hace poco decidió montar su propio negocio, una heladería ubicada en Amagá municipio que hace parte del departamento de Antioquia, allí trabaja diariamente de 10:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. con la ilusión de salir adelante y generar ingresos por sus propios medios, se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio y que sus clientes se deleiten con exquicitos helado; sin embargo no cuenta con el capital que necesita para invertirle al negocio, motivo por el cual hoy solicita un préstamo con el cual hacer algunas adecuaciones al local, comprar un enfriador y un surtido adecuado para ofrecer calidad y cantidad en sus productos e igualmente poder generar un ingreso economico para su sostenimiento. Aunque para Johana es duro no vivir actualmente en compañia de de su familia, ya que debe estar al frente de su negocio, sabe que podrá ayudar a su familia a tener un mejor futuro, y así mismo a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Johana is a young businesswoman who decided to begin her own business a short time ago. It's an ice cream store located in the municipality of Amagá which forms part of the department of Antioquia. She works there daily from 10am to 9pm with the desire to get ahead and generate her own income. Nevertheless, she doesn't have the capital she needs to invest in the business which is why she is requesting the loan to make some improvements to her store such as purchasing a freezer and an adequate supply of products to be able to offer quality and quantity in her products as well as generate an economic income for her sustainability. Although it's difficult for Johana to not currently live with her family since she has to be close to her business, she knows that she can help her family to have a better future and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: Adecuaciones locativas, Compra de un enfriador y surtido.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones,polos,blusas,chompas entre otras ropas, la socia vende ropa para varones,mujeres y niños, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor como pantalones, polos, blusas y chompas. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Jose Carlos Mariategui” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, widowed, and has four children. Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes. She sells trousers, polo shirts, blouses, sweaters, and other types of clothing. Rosa sells clothes for men, women, and children. She works from 7am to 6pm and sells her goods at the market in Urubamba. Through her business, Rosa is able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her business of selling clothes, so she is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk such as trousers, polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters.

Rosa is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk such as trousers, polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una emprendedora que desde hace dos años decidió crear su propio negocio desde su casa, una tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos productos de la canasta familiar, la tienda está ubicada en su propia casa lo que le permite estar pendiente del hogar y de sus hijos. 

Gloria necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos de aseo personal, los cuales son de gran demanda por parte de sus clientes, así mejorará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria is an entrepreneur who two years ago decided to create her own business from her house, a shop in which she offers her neighbors basic necessities. The store is located in her own house, which permits her to take care of her home and her children.

Gloria needs a loan to buy toiletries, which are in great demand by her customers. Thus she will improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy personal toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
