Olga; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de loceria,la socia vende tazas, platos y azucareras de material de loza y también la socia vende regalos como muñecas  y peluches, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de locería y venta de regalos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tazas, platos, muñecas y peluches al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the José Carlos Mariátegui Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cuzco.

The member is Olga; she is 49 and has a live-in partner and four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling china.  Olga sells earthenware cups, plates, and sugar bowls, and also gifts like dolls and stuffed animals.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She raises her children by means of this business.

Olga wants to expand her business selling china and gifts.  She is requesting the loan to buy cups, plates, dolls, and stuffed animals at wholesale prices.

Olga is happy about the loan and is committed to keeping her payment plan.

loans.use: to buy cups, plates, dolls, and stuffed animals at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet nació en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad, ella tiene relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de dos añitos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades, ella es cosmetóloga y tiene un salón de belleza pero el local es alquilado. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tintes, líquidos, champús y otras cosas más.    Sueño de la socia es mejorar el salón de belleza.  

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Janet was born in the city of Calca in the province of Cusco (Perú) and is 28 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has a 2 year old child from the relationship. Currently, she lives and works in the city of Cusco. She is a beautician and has a beauty salon in a rented property. She has had the business for the last 3 years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

Janet needs the loan to buy supplies such as dyes, liquids, shampoos as well as other things. The member's dream is to improve the beauty salon.

The communal bank “Siempre Adelante”  (Always Moving Forwards) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco (Perú). Cusco is well known as a popular tourist area, a business centre and for its tradional festival of Inti Raymi. It is also close to one of the seven wonders of the world “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as dyes, liquids, shampoos and the like.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes, la socia vende pelotas, muñecas, rompecabezas entre otros juguetes, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes al por mayor como muñecas, pelotas y carros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”. It is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Roxana. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner. She has 3 children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling toys. She sells balls, dolls, puzzles and other toys. She has a stall at the Urubamba market which is open from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Mrs Roxana wants to expand her toy-selling business. She is asking for the loan in order to buy toys in bulk such as dolls, balls and trucks.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy toys such as dolls, balls and trucks in bulk.

loans.name: Liz Danisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz Danisa; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropas interiores como medias y polos y también la socia vende ojotas que son como unos zapatos pero más tradicionales que usan las personas que viven en el campo, la socia trae la mercadería de lugares como Juliaca,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropas interiores y venta de ojetas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropas interiores y ojotas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of José Carlos Mariátegui Communal Bank, located in the District of Urubamba within the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

Liz Danisa is 33 years old, has a live-in partner, and three children. She alternates her daily activities with her underwear clothing business where she sells socks and polo shirts. She also sells ‘ojotas’ which are traditional shoes worn by people in rural areas. Liz Danisa brings merchandise from places like Juliaca. She works from 8am to 7pm and uses this business as a means of getting her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve her business selling underwear and ojotas and is requesting the loan for the purchase of wholesale underwear and ojotas.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale underwear and 'ojotas'.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella, D. 60 años es una mujer con espíritu joven y muy alegre, esta casada ya muchos años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo, nuera y su esposo.El trabajo D. Estrella consiste en vender bebidas gaseosas, este trabajo lo hace en su casa ya que hay bastante personas que buscan refrescarse ante el incremento D. la temperatura en esta parte del Perú, lleva haciendo este trabajo ya por mas D. 20 años, lo hace sola ya que su esposo trabaja D. manera independiente y sale temprano y vuelve muy tarD..
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que realizando esta actividad mas el trabajo D. su esposo pudo hacer muchas cosas, agradece que siempre haya ingresos y espera poder ampliar su negocio mas adelante.Este es el préstamo numero 14 entre Estrella y la institución MFP, esta muy contenta con el grupo formado, además D. tener  muchas ganas D. poder seguir trabajando ya que le agrada el trabajo con MFP por que los interés son muy bajos además D. acceder a los seguros a muy bajo costo.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles ella comprará bebidas gaseosas ya que es un mercado muy granD. y esta empezando a vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Estrella, age 60, is a cheerful woman with a youthful spirit. She has been married for several years and lives in her own home with her husband, her son, and her daughter-in-law. Her work consists of selling soft drinks from her home since there are plenty of people looking to buy refreshments as a result of the high temperatures in this part of Peru. Estrella has been in this business for more than 20 years. She works alone in her business since her husband is self-employed. He leaves early and returns home very late. What she likes most about her job is that it is more than work to her. It has allowed her husband to do more things, so she is grateful to always have income and hopes to expand her business going forward.

This is Estrella’s 14th loan with MFP. She is very pleased to be part of her group. In addition, she is determined to continue working with MFP because of the low interest rates and access to insurance at low cost. The amount of 1500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy sodas since she has a large market and is starting to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sodas in bulk.

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
Saida nació en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 20 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a traer fruta del valle de Yanatile con su suegra, ellas distribuyen sus productos en el mercado de Racsa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella también está estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad en la institución privada Khipu. 

Saida requiere el préstamo para pagar sus matriculas de sus estudios. El sueño de la socia es ser profesional.

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Saida was born in the city of Calca in the province of Cusco (Peru). She is 20 years old. She is in a common-law marriage from which she has one child. Currently, she lives and works in the city of Cusco. She works with her mother-in-law transporting fruit from the Yanatile valley to Cusco where they distribute the produce in the Racsa market. She is also studying professional accounting at the private institution Khipu.

Saida is asking for the loan in order to pay her tuition fees. Her dream is to become a professional.

The communal bank "Siempre Adelante" (Always Moving Forwards) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is well known as a popular tourist area, centre of commerce and for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi. It is also close to one of the seven wonders of the world Machupicchu".

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, leche, azúcar y galletas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”. It is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Gloria. She is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, oil, noodles and other products. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. and by means of this business manages to raise her children. The member wants to expand and improve her grocery store. She is asking for the loan in order to buy products such as rice, milk, sugar and biscuits.

The member is happy with the loan and agrees to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, milk, sugar and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Assimiou

texts.fr:
Assimiou est un homme âgé de 25 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant  
Assimiou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il achète et revend des articles electroniques pour ses clients dans sa boutique. Il travaille seule dans sa boutique. 
Assimiou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles electroniques et des portables pour revendre. Il veut agrandir son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Assimiou voudrait investir dans l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Assimou is a 25-year old man. He is single without children. Assimou has been working as vendor since 2010. He buys electronics and retails them in his store. He works by himself.

Assimou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy electronics and cellular phones for resale. He would like to expand his business. In the next few years, Assimou would like to keep investing in his business. He says that, with the income from his business, he  hopes to  be able to have a happy family one day.

loans.use: to buy electronics

loans.name: Aracely Anicia

texts.es:
Aracely,  tiene 4 años con el negocio que dejó su padre desde su fallecimiento, ella lo atiende sola desde muy temprano ya que su esposo hace otras actividades.  En su negocio ella vende artículos varios pero ahora quiere incrementar la línea de bazar ya que sus clientes le piden de todo un poco.  Su negocio está ubicado en su casa,  ella vive en la zona periurbana de fortín con caminos de tierra lo que hace un poco difícil el acceso.
Entre sus planes de inversión está solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercadería, como son artículos de bazar, y víveres en general; así podrá seguir apoyando en los gastos del hogar y en futuro quiere agrandar la casa.
texts.en:
Aracely inherited this business four years ago after her father died. She manages it alone, starting in the early morning hours, because her husband engages in other activities. In her business, Aracely sells various products but now she wants to expand the inventory of her bazaar because her customers want a little bit of everything. Her business is located in her home. Aracely lives in the periurban district of Fortín, which consists of dirt roads, thereby making this place difficult to access.

Her plans for investment include requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as bazaar goods and food in general. This will allow her to continue helping with the household expenses. In the future, she wants to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos, ella vende radios, televisores pequeños y linternas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artefactos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos pequeños como radios y linternas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”. It is located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Andrea. She is 48 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and selling electrical appliances. She sells radios, small televisions and flashlights. The member works from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Through her business she manages to get her children ahead in life. She wants to expand her business of selling electrical appliances. She is asking for a loan to buy small electrical appliances such as radios and flashlights in bulk.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances such as radios and flashlights in bulk.

loans.name: Liliana Gricelda

texts.es:
Liliana de 26 años en enero del 2011 se quedó sin trabajo,  se cansó de buscar empleo y no conseguía, hasta que decidió poner un pequeño negocio con su liquidación y unos pocos ahorros que había logrado reunir. En su tienda ella vende víveres como arroz, azúcar, enlatados, dulces, etc.
Debido a que el negocio recién empieza ella quiere un préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lápices y tener otra variedad que ofrecer a los clientes. No está casada y no tiene hijos pero cuenta que tiene que ayudar a sus padres en sus necesidades.
Su sueño es construir su casa, incrementar su negocio y ser feliz cuando se case.
texts.en:
Liliana is 26 years old. She lost her job in January 2011. Liliana grew tired of looking unsuccessfully for work, so she decided to start a small business with her severance pay and a little bit of savings that she had accumulated. She now has a store where she sells food products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, sweets, and other items.

Since her business is just beginning, Liliana needs a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, and a variety of other products to offer to her customers. She is not married and has no children, but she has the help of her parents with covering necessities. Her dreams include building a house, increasing her business, and being happy when she gets married.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, salt, sugar, rice, legumes, and canned goods.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Flora; tiene 65 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 6 hijos todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica al comercio  minorista, la socia  desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ganados y animales menores, como cuyes, aves de corral, la socia se dedica a la venta de carne, compra y venta de ganados, ovejas, compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, aves de corral;  la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca,  cuyes y aves de corral pollos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "FUENTE DE VIDA” (Fountain of Life). It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Flora, ia 65 years old. She is married and has 6 children, all of them self-reliant. The member is engaged in the retail trade. She wants to invest the loan in buying poultry and small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. The member sells meat, buys and sells cattle and sheep as well as small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. The member is asking for the loan in order to buy a cow, guinea pigs and poultry.

The member is grateful for the support given her and likewise agrees to make the repayments of her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a cow, guinea pigs and poultry

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelia; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración y venta de productos lácteos como yogurt, chocolate y miel, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria repartiendo a diferentes clientes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los chocolates, leche y azúcar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “IMASUMAC I". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Avelia. She is 56 years old. She is single and has 3 children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of making and selling dairy products such as yoghurt, chocolate and honey. She sells door-to-door, delivering her products to different customers. Through this business, the member has managed to get her children ahead in life. The member wants to expand and improve her business of selling dairy products. She is asking for a loan to buy consumables, milk and sugar, to make chocolate.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy consumables, milk and sugar, to make chocolates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Aguilas De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE CORAZÓN” iniciará su noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de deportivos, tienda, venta de toallas, confección de edredones, venta de videos, confección de chamarras, venta de ropa.

La señora Mery, indica que es el tercer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa que viene trabajando hace once años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de la C. Tumusla y posterior lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la el área de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "AGUILAS DE CORAZÓN" is beginning its ninth Pro Mujer cycle at the social center Los Andes.  It is comprised of 11 members and chaired by Mrs. Mery.  The bank's different businesses include: sports clothing production, running a store, towel sales, bedspread production, video sales, sweater production and clothing sales.

Mrs. Mery has been working with Pro Mujer for three years and joined through invitation.  She sells clothing, a trade which she leared from her mother, and has been in business for 11 years.

The loan she is requeting is to increase her working capital to buy clothing in Tumusla Street.  She will then sell it at the different street fairs.  Her business generates enough income to cover family expenses since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says its the loan and health areas.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es:
Mariana es integrante D. la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras D. Huampaní” grupo conformado por 09 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades comerciales. 
Mariana asume el cargo D. secretaria en el grupo, tiene 43 años es casada con 04 hijos los cuales 02 todavía depenD. ella, viendo que los ingresos del esposo no alcanzaban Mariana toma la decisión D. apoyarlo, ella se inicio vendiendo productos D. belleza la cual poco a poco fue ganando clientes, y por consiguiente sus ingresos se vieron  incrementados, teniendo el deseo D. querer surgir emprendió un nuevo negocio comprado 2 maquinas para poder alquilarlas en la actualidad cuenta con 6 computadoras la cual las alquila en su vivienda, con el fin D. implementar su negocio ha solicitado un  préstamo para la compra una impresora donD. pueda brindar servicio D. impresiones. El deseo D. Mariana es D. seguir trabajando bien,  para así posteriormente comprarse un carro para servicio D. movilidad. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras D. Huampani” están muy contentos y agradecen al Programa- Prosperidad. La Sra. Sonia no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras D. Huampani" which is comprised of nine people who are involved in different commercial activities.  She is the secretary of the group.

Mariana, 43, is married and has four children, two of which still live with her.  Since her husband's income was not enough to cover expenses, Mariana decided she wanted to help out and started selling beauty products.  Little by little she was able to take on customers and her income began to grow.  She then started a new business and bought two computers for rental purposes.  Now she has six that she rents out in her home.  In order to continue growing she has requested a loan to buy a printer so she can add that to her services.  Mariana's dream is to continue working so she can buy a car and proviD. transport services.  

The communal bank "Las Triunfadoras D. Huampani" is very happy and grateful to the Prosperity Program.  Mrs. Sonia could not be present for the photo because of work.

loans.use: To buy a printer.

loans.name: Chiefo

texts.en:
“I thought my life was heading on a path towards a career in public health,” shared Cheifo. But while serving in the Peace Corps in Ivory Coast, she fell in love with bissap, a sweet hibiscus drink. Chiefo returned home to the Bay Area and realized that she wanted to switch careers and get into the food industry. Having grown up in Nigeria, she longed for a stronger presence of West African cuisine in the local food scene. “I wanted to make West African food more popular in the Bay Area. It just wasn’t on anyone’s radar here,” explains Chiefo. 

With this goal in mind, Chiefo began perfecting her recipes in La Cocina’s incubator kitchen, a local non-profit organization supporting women culinary entrepreneurs. 

“La Cocina gave me the resources and support that I needed,” notes Chiefo. “It’s great to be surrounded by people who are just as nervous as you are, as well as people who are more experienced. It keeps me motivated and reminds me that I’m not alone as I pursue my dream in the food industry.”  

Chiefo launched her Sub-Sahara African catering business - Chiefo’s Kitchen - in 2009 at La Cocina’s Street Food Festival. It was one of the busiest booths! But in order to sell so much food, Chiefo also had to spend quite a lot of money to prepare for it—so much, in fact, that when 2011’s Street Food Festival rolled around, Chiefo was apprehensive about whether she would have enough capital to secure a booth and purchase the necessary ingredients. 

She confesses, “It came down to: Should I pay rent or should I be in the Street Food Festival?” Chiefo told her manager that she would be unable to participate in the festival. But La Cocina and Opportunity Fund have worked closely together in the past, and they knew they could put Chiefo in safe hands when they referred her to Opportunity Fund for a loan.  “I couldn’t believe it at first—it seemed too good to be true! It was the right loan that came at the right time.”

With her loan from Opportunity Fund secured, and solid business advising from La Cocina, Chiefo’s Kitchen was even more successful at this year’s Street Food Festival! “I felt much more comfortable this year and my booth was much more well-planned,” she gushes.  Energetic and motivated by the festival’s success, Chiefo is excited to continue working on her business’s mission to “elevate the presence and appreciation of the culinary treasures from sub-Saharan Africa in the Bay Area.”

loans.use: to secure a booth at La Cocina's Street Food Festival.
